verses.latin: Verba Nehemiæ filii Helchiæ. Et factum est in mense Casleu, anno vicesimo: et ego eram in Susis castro.
verses.english: This is the account of Nehemiah, the son of Hilkiah. It happened in the month of Chislev—the ninth month of the Jewish calendar—in the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes' reign, and I was in the citadel of Susa.

verses.latin: Et venit Hanani unus de fratribus meis, ipse et viri ex Juda: et interrogavi eos de Judæis qui evaserant, qui supererant de captivitate, et de Jerusalem.
verses.english: And Hanani, one of my brothers, came to me with some men from Judah. I questioned them about the Jews who had escaped and survived the exile, and about Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt mihi: Reliqui qui supererant de captivitate ibi in provincia, in afflictionibus magnis sunt, et opprobriis: et murus Jerusalem dissipatus est, et portæ ejus combustæ sunt igni.
verses.english: And they said to me: 'The remaining exiles there in the province of Judah are in great distress and public shame. The wall of Jerusalem has been torn down, and its gates have been burned to ashes by fire.'

verses.latin: Utque audivi sermones hujuscemodi, sedi, et flevi, et luxi diebus multis: et jejunabam, et orabam ante faciem Dei cæli.
verses.english: As soon as I heard these words, I sat down, wept, and mourned for many days. I fasted and prayed in the presence of the God of Heaven.

verses.latin: Et dixi: Obsecro Domine Deus cæli, Deus fortis, magne, et terribilis, custodiens pactum et misericordiam cum his qui diligunt te, et custodiunt præcepta tua.
verses.english: And I said: 'I implore You, Lord God of Heaven, O mighty, great, and awesome God, who keeps His covenant and shows mercy to those who love Him and obey His commands!'

verses.latin: Fiant aures tuæ patentes, et oculi tui aperti, ut exaudias orationem servi tui, quam ego oro coram te hodie, die ac nocte, pro filiis Israel servis tuis: et confiteor peccata filiorum Israel quibus peccaverunt tibi: ego et domus patris mei peccavimus.
verses.english: May Your ears be open and Your eyes attentive, that You may hear the prayer of Your servant, which I am praying before You today, day and night, for Your servants, the children of Israel. I confess the sins of the children of Israel, which they have committed against You—my father's household and I have also sinned.

verses.latin: Vanitati seducti sumus, et non custodivimus mandata tua, et cæremonias tuas, et judicia tua, quæ præcepisti Moysi servo tuo.
verses.english: We have acted corruptly and strayed from You, for we have not kept Your commandments, Your statutes, and Your ordinances, which You commanded through Your servant Moses.

verses.latin: Memento verbi quod mandasti Moysi servo tuo, dicens: Cum transgressi fueritis, ego dispergam vos in populos:
verses.english: Remember the word that You gave to Your servant Moses, saying: 'If you transgress, I will scatter you among the nations.

verses.latin: et si revertamini ad me, et custodiatis præcepta mea, et faciatis illa: etiam si abducti fueritis ad extrema cæli, inde congregabo vos, et inducam in locum quem elegi, ut nomen meum ibi habitet.
verses.english: But if you return to Me, and keep My commands, and do them—even if you have been carried away to the furthest reaches of the universe—from there I will gather you and bring you to the place which I have chosen, that My Name may reside there.'

verses.latin: Et isti servi tui, et populus tuus, quos redemisti in fortitudine tua magna, et in manu tua valida.
verses.english: These are Your servants and Your people, whom You redeemed with Your great power and Your mighty hand.

verses.latin: Obsecro Domine, præbe aurem tuam deprecationi servi tui, et deprecationi servorum tuorum, qui volunt timere nomen tuum: et fac prosperum servum tuum hodie, et da ei gratiam ante virum hunc. Ego enim eram pincerna regis.
verses.english: I implore You, Lord, incline Your ear to the prayer of Your servant, and to the prayer of Your servants who desire to revere Your Name. Grant success to Your servant today, and grant him favor in the sight of this man—for I was the king's cupbearer.

verses.latin: Verba Nehemiae filii Helchiae. Et factum est in mense Casleu, anno vicesimo: et ego eram in Susis castro.
verses.english: These are the historical accounts of Nehemiah, son of Helchia. This occurred in the month of Casleu, during the twentieth year of the king's reign, while I was residing in the citadel of Susa.

verses.latin: Factum est autem in mense Nisan, anno vicesimo Artaxerxis regis, et vinum erat ante eum: et levavi vinum, et dedi regi. Et non eram tristis ante eum.
verses.english: Now it came to pass in the month of Nisan, in the twentieth year of King Artaxerxes, that the wine was placed before him. I, Nehemiah, then took the wine and gave it to the king. Before this day, I had not shown any sadness in his presence, for it was forbidden to approach the king with a sorrowful demeanor.

verses.latin: Et dixit rex mihi: Quare vultus tuus tristis est, cum te ægrum non videam? non est hoc aliud, nisi mœror cordis. Et timui valde.
verses.english: And the king said to me, 'Why is your face sad, seeing that I see no sign of illness in you? This can only be sorrow within your heart.' And at this question, I became greatly afraid.

verses.latin: Et dixi regi: Rex in æternum vive! quare non mœrens sit vultus meus, quia civitas domus sepulchrorum patrum meorum deserta est, et portæ ejus igni consumptæ sunt?
verses.english: And I said to the king, 'O king, live forever! Why should my face not show sorrow, seeing that the city where my fathers are buried—Jerusalem—lies desolate, and its gates have been consumed by fire?'

verses.latin: Et ait mihi rex: Pro qua re postulas? Et oravi Deum cæli.
verses.english: And the king said to me, 'What do you wish to request?' And at that very moment, I prayed to the God of the universe.

verses.latin: Et dixi regi: Si videtur bonum regi, et si placet servo tuo ante faciem tuam, ut mittas me in Judæam ad civitatem sepulchri patrum meorum, et ædificem eam.
verses.english: And I said to the king, 'If it seems good to the king, and if your servant finds favor in your sight, I request that you send me to Judea, to the city where my fathers are buried, so that I may rebuild it.'

verses.latin: Dixitque mihi rex (et regina sedebat juxta eum): Usque ad quod tempus erit iter tuum, et quando revertes? Et placuit ante regem, et misit me: et constitui illi tempus.
verses.english: And the king said to me (with the queen sitting beside him), 'For what period of time will your journey be, and when will you return?' And the matter pleased the king, and he sent me. I also set a specific time for my return for him.

verses.latin: Et dixi regi: Si bonum est regi, epistolas des mihi ad duces regionis trans flumen, ut transducant me donec veniam in Judæam:
verses.english: And I said to the king, 'If it is good in the sight of the king, let letters be given to me for the governors of the region beyond the river Euphrates, so that they may grant me safe passage until I come to Judea.'

verses.latin: et epistolam ad Asaph custodem saltus regis, ut det mihi ligna ut tegere possim portas turris domus, et muros civitatis, et domum in quam introiero. Et dedit mihi rex juxta manum Dei mei bonam mecum.
verses.english: 'And also a letter to Asaph, the keeper of the king's forest, so that he may give me timber to cover the gates of the fortress that belongs to the temple, and the walls of the city of Jerusalem, and the house into which I will enter.' And the king granted me all these things, because the good hand—the favor—of my God was upon me.

verses.latin: Et veni ad duces regionis trans flumen, dedique eis epistolas regis. Dederat autem mecum rex principes militum, et equites.
verses.english: So I came to the governors of the region beyond the river, and I delivered the king's letters to them. The king had also sent with me captains of the army and horsemen for protection and escort.

verses.latin: Et audivit Sanaballat Horonites, et Tobias servus Ammanites, et contristati sunt afflictionibus magnis, eo quod venisset homo qui quæreret prosperitatem filiorum Israël.
verses.english: Now when Sanaballat the Horonite and Tobias, the Ammonite official, heard of this, they were greatly displeased. They were greatly distressed that a man had come seeking the prosperity of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Et veni Jerusalem, et eram ibi tribus diebus.
verses.english: And I came to Jerusalem, and I was there for three days.

verses.latin: Et surrexi nocte ego et viri pauci mecum, et non indicavi cuiquam quid Deus meus dedisset in corde meo ut facerem in Jerusalem: et jumentum non erat mecum, nisi jumentum cui sedebam.
verses.english: Then I arose in the night, I and a few men with me, and I did not tell anyone what my God had put into my heart to do for Jerusalem. There was no animal with me, except for the animal on which I was riding.

verses.latin: Et egressus sum per portam Vallis nocte, et ad fontem Draconis, et ad portam Stercoris: et considerabam muros Jerusalem dissipatos, et portas ejus igni consumptas.
verses.english: And I went out by night through the Valley Gate, and proceeded towards the Dragon's Spring, and to the Dung Gate. As I went, I carefully inspected the broken-down walls of Jerusalem and its gates that had been consumed by fire.

verses.latin: Et transivi ad portam Fontis, et ad aquarum regis: et non erat locus jumento cui sedebam, ut transiret.
verses.english: Then I passed on to the Fountain Gate and to the King's Pool. But there was no place for the animal on which I was riding to pass through, because of the debris.

verses.latin: Et ascendi per torrentem nocte, et considerabam murum, et reversus rursum veni ad portam Vallis.
verses.english: So I went up by the torrent in the night, and again inspected the wall. After completing my survey, I returned and came back to the Valley Gate.

verses.latin: Et magistratus nesciebant quo abiissem, aut quid facerem: sed et Judæis, et sacerdotibus, et optimatibus, et magistratibus, et reliquis qui faciebant opus, usque ad id tempus nihil indicaveram.
verses.english: And the officials of the city did not know where I had gone or what I was doing, because up to that time I had not yet told the Jews, or the priests, or the nobles, or the officials, or the rest of those who were to do the work, of my intentions.

verses.latin: Et dixi eis: Vos videtis afflictionem in qua sumus, quia Jerusalem deserta est, et portæ ejus sunt succensæ igni. Venite, et ædificemus muros Jerusalem, et non simus ultra opprobrium.
verses.english: Then I said to them, 'You see the deep affliction in which we are, because Jerusalem lies desolate and its gates are burned with fire. Come, let us rebuild the walls of Jerusalem, so that we may no longer be an object of shame and reproach.'

verses.latin: Et indicavi eis manum Dei mei, quod esset bona mecum, et verba regis quæ locutus esset mihi. Et dixerunt: Surgamus, et ædificemus. Et confortata est manus eorum in bono.
verses.english: And I recounted to them how the hand—the favor—of my God had been good upon me, and also the words of the king which he had spoken to me. And they said, 'Let us arise and build!' And their hands were strengthened for the good work.

verses.latin: Audierunt autem Sanaballat Horonites, et Tobias servus Ammanites, et Gosem Arabs: et subsannaverunt nos, et despexerunt, et dixerunt: Quid est hoc quod facitis? numquid contra regem vos rebellare?
verses.english: But when Sanaballat the Horonite, and Tobias the Ammonite official, and Gosem the Arab heard of it, they ridiculed us and despised us, and they said, 'What is this thing that you are doing? Are you intending to rebel against the king?'

verses.latin: Et reddidi eis sermonem, dicens: Deus cæli ipse nos juvabit: et nos servi ejus ædificabimus: vobis autem non est pars, et justitia, et memoria in Jerusalem.
verses.english: And I answered them, saying, 'The God of the universe Himself will help us, and we, His servants, will build. But as for you, you have no portion, nor right, nor memorial in Jerusalem.'

verses.latin: Factum est autem in mense Nisan, anno vigesimo Artaxerxis regis, et vinum erat ante eum: et levavi vinum, et dedi regi. Et non eram quasi languidus ante faciem ejus.
verses.english: It happened in the month of Nisan, the first month of the Jewish calendar, in the twentieth year of the reign of King Artaxerxes. The wine was before the king, and it was my duty to take the wine and give it to him. I was not normally sad or downcast in his presence.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi rex: Quare vultus tuus tristis est, cum te ægrum non videam? non est hoc nisi malum cordis. Et timui vehementer.
verses.english: And the king said to me, 'Why is your face so sad, seeing that I do not see you to be physically ill? This can only be a deep sadness in your heart.' And I was greatly afraid.

verses.latin: Et dixi regi: Rex in æternum vive: quare non mœreret vultus meus, quia civitas domus sepulchrorum patrum meorum deserta est, et portæ ejus igni consumptæ sunt?
verses.english: Then I said to the king, 'May the king live forever! How could my face not be sad, given that the city—the place where my ancestors are buried—lies in ruins, and its gates have been consumed by fire?'

verses.latin: Et ait mihi rex (et regina sedebat juxta eum): Pro quo vultu petis? Et oravi Deum cæli.
verses.english: Then the king said to me (with the queen sitting beside him), 'What is it you are requesting, then, with such a look on your face?' At that very moment, I prayed silently to the God of Heaven.

verses.latin: Et dixi regi: Si regi placet, et si placet servus tuus ante faciem tuam, ut mittas me in Judæam, in civitatem sepulchri patrum meorum, et ædificabo eam.
verses.english: And I said to the king, 'If it pleases the king, and if your servant has found favor in your sight, I request that you send me to Judea, to the city where my ancestors are buried—Jerusalem—so that I may rebuild it.'

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi rex (et regina sedebat juxta eum): Usque ad quod tempus erit iter tuum, et quando reverteris? Et placuit ante faciem regis, et misit me: et constitui ei tempus.
verses.english: Then the king said to me (with the queen still sitting beside him), 'How long will your journey take, and when will you return?' The king was pleased with my request, and he sent me. I specified a time for my return to him.

verses.latin: Et dixi regi: Si regi placet, epistolas des mihi ad duces regionis trans flumen, ut transducant me, donec veniam in Judæam:
verses.english: And I also said to the king, 'If it pleases the king, please provide me with letters of passage addressed to the governors of the province Beyond the River—the region west of the Euphrates—so that they will allow me to travel through their territories until I reach Judea.'

verses.latin: et epistolam ad Asaph custodem saltus regis, ut det mihi ligna, ut tegere possim portas turris domus, et muros civitatis, et domum in qua sedero. Et dedit mihi rex juxta manum Dei mei bonam mecum.
verses.english: And also a letter addressed to Asaph, the keeper of the king's forest, instructing him to provide me with timber. This wood will be used to construct the gates for the fortress connected to the Temple, for the city walls, and for the house where I will reside. The king granted all my requests, for the good hand of my God was upon me and guided him.

verses.latin: Et veni ad duces regionis trans flumen, et dedi eis litteras regis: et misit me rex cum principibus militum et equitibus.
verses.english: So I traveled to the governors of the province Beyond the River and presented them with the king's letters. The king had also provided me with an escort of army officers and cavalrymen.

verses.latin: Et audivit Sanaballat Horonites, et Tobias servus Ammanites, et contristati sunt afflictione magna, eo quod venisset homo qui quæreret prosperitatem filiorum Israël.
verses.english: When Sanballat the Horonite and Tobiah the Ammonite official heard about my arrival, they were deeply displeased and greatly troubled, because a man had come to seek the welfare and prosperity of the children of Israel.

verses.latin: Et veni Jerusalem, et eram ibi tribus diebus.
verses.english: Finally, I arrived in Jerusalem, and I remained there for three days.

verses.latin: Et surrexi nocte ego et viri pauci mecum, et non indicavi cuiquam quid Deus dedisset in corde meo ut facerem in Jerusalem, et jumentum non erat mecum, nisi jumentum cui sedebam ego.
verses.english: Then, during the night, I arose with only a few men accompanying me. I had not told anyone what God had inspired me to do for Jerusalem. There was no pack animal with us, only the animal I myself was riding.

verses.latin: Et egressus sum per portam Vallis nocte, et ad fontem Draconis, et ad portam Stercoris: et considerabam muros Jerusalem dissipatos, et portas ejus consumptas igni.
verses.english: I went out through the Valley Gate at night, proceeding towards the Dragon's Well and then to the Dung Gate. As I went, I carefully inspected the walls of Jerusalem, observing how they lay in ruins, and how its gates had been completely destroyed by fire.

verses.latin: Et transivi ad portam Fontis, et ad Piscinam regis, et non erat locus jumento cui sedebam ut transiret.
verses.english: From there, I went on to the Fountain Gate and the King's Pool. But at that point, there was so much rubble and damage that there was no room for the animal I was riding to pass through.

verses.latin: Et ascendi per torrentem nocte, et considerabam murum, et reversus sum ad portam Vallis.
verses.english: So I continued my inspection by ascending the valley at night, carefully examining the wall. Afterward, I returned by way of the Valley Gate.

verses.latin: Magistratus autem nescierunt quo abiissem, aut quid facerem: sed et Judæis, et sacerdotibus, et optimatibus, et magistratibus, et reliquis qui faciebant opus, usque ad hoc tempus nihil indicaveram.
verses.english: The local officials, however, did not know where I had gone or what I was doing. Indeed, I had not yet revealed anything to the Jewish people, the priests, the nobles, the other officials, or anyone else who would be involved in the work, keeping my plans secret until the proper time.

verses.latin: Et dixi eis: Vos videtis afflictionem in qua sumus, quia Jerusalem deserta est, et portæ ejus exustæ sunt igni: venite, et ædificemus muros Jerusalem, et non simus ultra opprobrium.
verses.english: Then I said to them, 'You yourselves see the terrible condition we are in: Jerusalem lies in ruins, and its gates have been completely burned down by fire. Come, let us rebuild the walls of Jerusalem, so that we may no longer suffer this shame and disgrace.'

verses.latin: Et indicavi eis manum Dei mei, quod esset bona mecum, et verba regis quæ locutus esset mihi: et dixerunt: Surgamus, et ædificemus. Et confortata est manus eorum in bono.
verses.english: I also told them about the gracious hand of my God that had been upon me, and repeated the words the king had spoken to me. Immediately, they responded, 'Let us rise up and build!' And their resolve was greatly strengthened for this good work.

verses.latin: Audierunt autem Sanaballat Horonites, et Tobias servus Ammanites, et Gosem Arabs: et subsannaverunt nos, et despexerunt, et dixerunt: Quid est hoc opus quod facitis? numquid contra regem rebellatis?
verses.english: But when Sanballat the Horonite, Tobiah the Ammonite official, and Geshem the Arab heard of our plans, they mocked us and scorned us. They said, 'What is this thing you are doing? Are you actually rebelling against the king?'

verses.latin: Et reddidi eis sermonem, et dixi eis: Deus cæli ipse nos juvat: et nos servi ejus ædificamus: vobis autem non est pars, et justitia, et memoria in Jerusalem.
verses.english: I answered them directly and said, 'The God of Heaven Himself will give us success! We, His servants, will rise up and build. But as for you, you have no share, no right, and no historical claim in Jerusalem.'

verses.latin: Et Eliashib sacerdos magnus, et fratres ejus sacerdotes, aedificaverunt portam Gregis: ipsi sanctificaverunt eam, et statuerunt ostia ejus: et usque ad turrim Centum sanctificaverunt eam, usque ad turrim Hananeel.
verses.english: And Eliashib, the high priest, along with his priestly brethren, began building the Sheep Gate. They consecrated this section of the wall and installed its doors, continuing to consecrate the wall as far as the Tower of the Hundred, and then all the way to the Tower of Hananeel.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificaverunt viri Jericho: et post eum ædificavit Zachur filius Amri.
verses.english: Next to them, the men of Jericho built their section of the wall. And after them, Zachur, the son of Amri, built his portion.

verses.latin: Portam autem Piscium aedificaverunt filii Senaa: ipsi texerunt eam, et statuerunt ostia ejus, et seras, et vectes.
verses.english: The Sons of Senaa were responsible for building the Fish Gate. They covered and reinforced it, then installed its doors, along with its locks and sturdy bars.

verses.latin: Et juxta eos ædificavit Marimoth filius Uriæ filii Accus: et juxta eum ædificavit Mosollam filius Barachiæ filii Mazabel: et juxta eum ædificavit Sadoc filius Baana.
verses.english: Next to them, Marimoth, the son of Uria, son of Accus, built his section. And next to him, Mosollam, the son of Barachia, son of Mazabel, built his part. And next to him, Sadoc, the son of Baana, also built.

verses.latin: Et juxta eos ædificaverunt Thecueni: patres autem eorum non supposuere colla sua in opere Domini sui.
verses.english: And next to these, the Thecoites built their portion of the wall. However, their nobles did not apply themselves to the work of their Lord, refusing to do their part.

verses.latin: Portam autem Veterem ædificavit Jojada filius Phasea, et Mosollam filius Besodiæ: ipsi texerunt eam, et statuerunt ostia ejus, et seras, et vectes.
verses.english: Jojada, the son of Phasea, and Mosollam, the son of Besodia, built the Old Gate. They covered and strengthened it, then installed its doors, its locks, and its bars.

verses.latin: Et juxta eos ædificavit Melatias Gabaonites, et Jadon Meronathites, viri Gabaon et Maspha, pro tribunali Ducis qui erat in regione trans flumen.
verses.english: Next to them, Melatias the Gabaonite and Jadon the Meronathite, men from Gabaon and Maspha, built their section. This was by the tribunal of the governor who oversaw the region beyond the river Euphrates.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Eziel filius Aurariæ: et juxta eum ædificavit Hananias filius unguentariorum: et dimiserunt Jerusalem usque ad murum latum.
verses.english: And next to him, Eziel, son of the Goldsmiths, built his part. And next to him, Hananias, son of the Perfume-makers, also built. They continued the rebuilding in Jerusalem all the way to the Broad Wall.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Raphaia filius Hur, princeps vici.
verses.english: Next to him, Raphaia, the son of Hur, a leader of a district, built his section.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Idaias filius Haromaph, contra domum suam: et juxta eum ædificavit Hattus filius Haseboniæ.
verses.english: Next to him, Idaias, the son of Haromaph, built a section directly opposite his own house. And next to him, Hattus, the son of Hasebonia, built his part.

verses.latin: Mediæ partes ædificavit Melchias filius Haram, filius Phaath Moab, et turrim Furnorum.
verses.english: Melchias, the son of Haram, son of Phaath Moab, built the next section, which included the Tower of the Furnaces.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Sellum filius Alohes, princeps medietatis vici Jerusalem, ipse et filiæ ejus.
verses.english: Next to him, Sellum, the son of Alohes, a leader of half of the district of Jerusalem, built his section, along with his daughters, who also participated in the work.

verses.latin: Portam Vallis ædificavit Hanun, et habitatores Zanoë: ipsi ædificaverunt eam, et statuerunt ostia ejus, et seras, et vectes: et mille cubitis in muro usque ad portam Stercoris.
verses.english: Hanun and the inhabitants of Zanoë built the Valley Gate. They built it and installed its doors, its locks, and its bars. They then continued building the wall for a thousand cubits, reaching all the way to the Dung Gate.

verses.latin: Portam Stercoris ædificavit Melchias filius Rechab, princeps vici Bethacarem: ipse ædificavit eam, et statuit ostia ejus, et seras, et vectes.
verses.english: Melchias, the son of Rechab, a leader of the district of Bethacarem, built the Dung Gate. He built it and installed its doors, its locks, and its bars.

verses.latin: Et portam Fontis ædificavit Sellum filius Colhoza, princeps vici Maspha: ipse ædificavit eam, et texit, et statuit ostia ejus, et seras, et vectes: et murum piscinæ Siloë ad hortum regis, et usque ad gradus qui descendunt de civitate David.
verses.english: Sellum, the son of Colhoza, a leader of the district of Maspha, built the Fountain Gate. He built it, covered and strengthened it, then installed its doors, its locks, and its bars. He also built the wall of the pool of Siloë by the king’s garden, extending as far as the steps that lead down from the city of David.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificavit Nehemias filius Azboc, princeps medietatis vici Bethsur, usque contra sepulchrum David, et usque ad piscinam quæ fabrica fuerat, et usque ad domum Fortium.
verses.english: After him, Nehemias, the son of Azboc, a leader of half the district of Bethsur, built his section. This extended opposite the tomb of David, as far as the pool that had been constructed, and then to the House of the Mighty.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificaverunt Levitæ, Rehum filius Bani: juxta eum ædificavit Hasebias princeps medietatis vici Ceila, in vico suo.
verses.english: After him, the Levites built, specifically Rehum, the son of Bani. Next to him, Hasebias, a leader of half the district of Ceila, built his section in his own district.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificaverunt fratres eorum, Bavai filius Enadad, princeps medietatis Ceila.
verses.english: After him, their brethren built, specifically Bavai, the son of Enadad, a leader of half the district of Ceila.

verses.latin: Et ædificavit juxta eum Aser filius Josuæ, princeps Maspha, mensuram secundam contra ascensum fortissimum anguli.
verses.english: And next to him, Aser, the son of Josua, a leader of Maspha, built a second section, directly opposite the strong ascent at the corner of the wall.

verses.latin: Post eum sedulo ædificavit Baruch filius Zachai, mensuram secundam, ab angulo usque ad portam domus Eliashib sacerdotis magni.
verses.english: After him, Baruch, the son of Zachai, zealously built a second, full section. This stretched from the corner all the way to the entrance of the house of Eliashib, the high priest.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificavit Marimoth filius Uriæ filii Accus, mensuram secundam, a porta domus Eliashib usque ad finem domus Eliashib.
verses.english: After him, Marimoth, the son of Uria, son of Accus, built a second section. This extended from the entrance of Eliashib’s house all the way to the end of Eliashib’s house.

verses.latin: Et post eum ædificaverunt sacerdotes, viri de campestribus.
verses.english: And after him, the priests, men from the surrounding plains, also built their section.

verses.latin: Post hunc ædificavit Benjamin et Hassub contra domum suam: et post hunc ædificavit Azarias filius Maasæ filii Ananiæ contra domum suam.
verses.english: After this, Benjamin and Hassub built directly opposite their own houses. And after them, Azarias, the son of Maasæ, son of Ananias, built his section opposite his own house.

verses.latin: Post hunc ædificavit Banna filius Henadad, mensuram secundam, a domo Azariæ usque ad flexuram, et usque ad angulum.
verses.english: After this, Banna, the son of Henadad, built a second section. This extended from Azarias’ house all the way to the bend in the wall, and then to the corner.

verses.latin: Phalel filius Ozi, contra flexuram et turrim quæ eminet de domo regia, id est, de atrio carceris: juxta eum Pedeia filius Pharos.
verses.english: Phalel, the son of Ozi, built opposite the bend in the wall, and by the tower that projects from the royal palace, specifically from the court of the prison. Next to him, Pedeia, the son of Pharos, built.

verses.latin: Et Nathinæi habitabant in Ophel usque contra portam Aquarum orientales, et turrim quæ prominet.
verses.english: (The Nethinim, the temple servants, lived in Ophel.) They also built the section opposite the Water Gate to the east, and the tower that projects out.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificaverunt Thecueni, mensuram secundam, ab angulo contra turrim maximam, et eminet usque ad murum Ophel.
verses.english: After them, the Thecoites built a second section, from the great projecting tower all the way to the wall of Ophel.

verses.latin: Et supra portam equorum ædificaverunt sacerdotes, unusquisque contra domum suam.
verses.english: Above the Horse Gate, the priests built, each one directly opposite his own house.

verses.latin: Post eos ædificavit Sadoc filius Emmer contra domum suam: et post eum ædificavit Semeia filius Secheniæ custos portæ orientalis.
verses.english: After them, Sadoc, the son of Emmer, built opposite his own house. And after him, Semeia, the son of Sechenia, the keeper of the East Gate, built his section.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificavit Hananias filius Selemia, et Hanun filius Seliph sextus, mensuram secundam: post hunc ædificavit Mosollam filius Barachiæ contra gazophylacium suum.
verses.english: After him, Hananias, the son of Selemia, and Hanun, the sixth son of Seliph, built a second section. After this, Mosollam, the son of Barachia, built opposite his own treasury.

verses.latin: Post ipsum ædificavit Melchias filius Aurificis usque ad domum Nathinæorum, et mercatorum, contra portam Judiciariam, et usque ad cœnaculum anguli.
verses.english: After him, Melchias, the son of the Goldsmith, built all the way to the house of the Nethinim, and the merchants, opposite the Judgment Gate, and then to the upper chamber at the corner.

verses.latin: Et inter cœnaculum anguli et portam Gregis, ædificaverunt aurifices et mercatores.
verses.english: And between the upper chamber at the corner and the Sheep Gate, the goldsmiths and merchants completed their work.

verses.latin: Et surrexit Eliasib sacerdos magnus et fratres ejus sacerdotes, et ædificaverunt Portam Gregis: ipsi sanctificaverunt eam, et statuerunt ostia ejus usque ad turrim Centum, usque ad turrim Hananeel.
verses.english: Then Eliashib, the high priest, along with his fellow priests, rose up and began the work. They rebuilt the Sheep Gate and consecrated it, setting its doors in place. They continued rebuilding the wall from there, reaching as far as the Tower of the Hundred, and then further, up to the Tower of Hananel.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificaverunt viri de Jericho: et juxta eos ædificavit Zachur filius Amri.
verses.english: Next to them, the men from Jericho carried out their part of the rebuilding. And beside them, Zaccur, the son of Imri, rebuilt his section.

verses.latin: Portam autem Piscium ædificaverunt filii Asnaa: ipsi tegebant eam, et statuerunt ostia ejus, et seras ejus, et vectes ejus.
verses.english: The sons of Hassenaah rebuilt the Fish Gate. They laid its beams, set its doors, and installed its bolts and bars.

verses.latin: Et juxta eos ædificavit Marimoth filius Uriæ filii Accus: et juxta eum ædificavit Mosollam filius Barachiæ filii Mesezebel: et juxta illum ædificavit Sadoc filius Baana.
verses.english: Next to them, Meremoth, the son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz, worked. Beside him, Meshullam, the son of Berechiah, the son of Meshezabel, rebuilt his section. And next to him, Zadok, the son of Baana, also repaired a section.

verses.latin: Et juxta illum ædificaverunt Thecuitæ: principes autem eorum non subposuerunt colla sua in opere Domini sui.
verses.english: Beside him, the Tekoites repaired their part of the wall. However, their nobles did not put their shoulders to the work of their Lord, refusing to participate in God’s divinely appointed task.

verses.latin: Portam veterem ædificaverunt Jojada filius Fasea, et Mosollam filius Besodiæ: ipsi tegebant eam, et statuerunt ostia ejus, et seras ejus, et vectes ejus.
verses.english: Joiada, the son of Paseah, and Meshullam, the son of Besodeiah, rebuilt the Old Gate. They laid its beams, set its doors, and installed its bolts and bars.

verses.latin: Et juxta eos ædificaverunt Meltias Gabaonites, et Jadon Meronathites, viri de Gabaon et Maspha, pro tribunali ducis trans flumen.
verses.english: Next to them, Melatiah the Gibeonite and Jadon the Meronothite rebuilt their section. These were men from Gibeon and Mizpah, working on the wall up to the seat of the governor of the region beyond the River Jordan.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Ozihel filius aurificis, Haraias filius pigmentariorum: et reliquerunt Jerusalem usque ad murum latissimum.
verses.english: Next to him, Uzziel, the son of Harhaiah, one of the goldsmiths, worked. And next to him, Hananiah, one of the perfumers, repaired his section. They rebuilt Jerusalem's wall all the way to the Broad Wall.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Raphaia filius Hur, princeps vici.
verses.english: Beside him, Rephaiah, the son of Hur, the ruler of half of the district of Jerusalem, rebuilt his section.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Jedaia filius Haromaph e regione domus suæ: et juxta eum ædificavit Hattus filius Haseboniæ.
verses.english: Next to him, Jedaiah, the son of Harumaph, rebuilt the wall opposite his own house. And next to him, Hattush, the son of Hashabneiah, also worked.

verses.latin: Machiæ filius Harim, et Hasub filius Phaath Moab ædificaverunt partem secundam, et turrim Furnorum.
verses.english: Malchijah, the son of Harim, and Hasshub, the son of Pahath-Moab, rebuilt another section, which included the Tower of the Ovens.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Sellum filius Alohes, princeps medietatis vici Jerusalem, ipse et filiæ ejus.
verses.english: Next to him, Shallum, the son of Hallohesh, the ruler of half of the district of Jerusalem, rebuilt his section, along with his daughters, who also participated in the work.

verses.latin: Portam vallis ædificavit Hanun, et habitatores Zanoë: ipsi ædificaverunt eam, et statuerunt ostia ejus, et seras ejus, et vectes ejus, et mille cubitos in muro usque ad Portam Sterquilinii.
verses.english: Hanun and the inhabitants of Zanoah rebuilt the Valley Gate. They built it, set its doors in place, and installed its bolts and bars. They then continued for a thousand cubits—about 1,500 feet—along the wall, all the way to the Dung Gate.

verses.latin: Portam Sterquilinii ædificavit Melchias filius Rechab, princeps vici Bethacarem: ipse ædificavit eam, et statuit ostia ejus, et seras ejus, et vectes ejus.
verses.english: Malchijah, the son of Rechab, the ruler of the district of Beth Haccherem, rebuilt the Dung Gate. He built it and set its doors, bolts, and bars in place.

verses.latin: Portam Fontis ædificavit Sellum filius Cholhoza, princeps vici Maspha: ipse ædificavit eam, et texit, et statuit ostia ejus, et seras ejus, et vectes ejus, et murum piscinæ Siloë ad hortum regis, et usque ad gradus qui descendunt de civitate David.
verses.english: Shallun, the son of Col-Hozeh, the ruler of the district of Mizpah, rebuilt the Fountain Gate. He rebuilt it, laid its beams, and set its doors, bolts, and bars in place. He also rebuilt the wall of the Pool of Siloam near the king's garden, and continued all the way to the steps that lead down from the City of David.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificavit Nehemias filius Azboc, princeps medietatis vici Bethsur, usque contra sepulchrum David, et usque ad piscinam quæ fabrica est, et usque ad domum Fortium.
verses.english: After him, Nehemiah, the son of Azbuk, the ruler of half of the district of Beth-Zur, rebuilt his section. This ran opposite the tombs of David, as far as the artificial pool, and then further, to the House of the Mighty Men.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificaverunt Levitæ, Rehum filius Bani: juxta eum ædificavit Hasebias princeps medietatis vici Ceila in vico suo.
verses.english: After him, the Levites repaired their sections. Rehum, the son of Bani, worked there. Next to him, Hashabiah, the ruler of half of the district of Keilah, rebuilt his section within his own district.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificaverunt fratres eorum Bavai filius Enadad, princeps medietatis vici Ceila.
verses.english: After him, their brethren rebuilt their sections: Bavvai, the son of Henadad, the ruler of half of the district of Keilah.

verses.latin: Et juxta eum ædificavit Aser filius Jesu, princeps Maspha, partem alteram e regione ascensus firmissimi.
verses.english: Next to him, Ezer, the son of Jeshua, the ruler of Mizpah, rebuilt another section opposite the ascent to the Armory, a very strong point on the wall.

verses.latin: Post eum in monte ædificavit Baruch filius Zabba alteram mensuram a fronte domus Eliægib sacerdotis magni.
verses.english: After him, Baruch, the son of Zabbai, rebuilt another section of the wall, located on the hill, extending from the area opposite the house of Eliashib, the high priest.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificavit Marimoth filius Uriæ filii Accus, mensuram alteram a porta domus Eliægib usque ad portam domus Eliægib.
verses.english: After him, Meremoth, the son of Uriah, the son of Hakkoz, rebuilt another section, extending from the entrance of Eliashib's house to the far side of Eliashib's house.

verses.latin: Et post eum ædificaverunt sacerdotes viri de campestribus Jordanis.
verses.english: And after him, the priests, men from the plains of the Jordan, also rebuilt their sections.

verses.latin: Et post eum ædificavit Benjamin et Hasub, e regione domus suæ: et post eum ædificavit Azarias filius Maasæ filii Ananiæ, juxta domum suam.
verses.english: After him, Benjamin and Hasshub rebuilt their sections opposite their own houses. And after them, Azariah, the son of Maaseiah, the son of Ananiah, rebuilt the wall next to his own house.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificavit Bennui filius Enadad, mensuram alteram, a domo Azariæ usque ad flexuram, et usque ad angulum.
verses.english: After him, Binnui, the son of Henadad, rebuilt another section, from Azariah's house up to the buttress and the corner.

verses.latin: Phalal filius Ozi ædificavit e regione flexuræ et turris quæ eminet de domo regis excelsa, quæ est in atrio carceris: post eum Phadaia filius Pharos.
verses.english: Palal, the son of Uzai, rebuilt the wall opposite the buttress and the tower that projects from the upper house of the king, which is by the court of the guard. After him, Pedaiah, the son of Parosh, rebuilt his section.

verses.latin: Et Nathinæi habitabant in Ophel usque contra aquarum Portam orientales, et turrim prominentem.
verses.english: The temple servants (Nethinim) who lived in Ophel repaired their sections, working opposite the Water Gate toward the east and the projecting tower.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificaverunt Thecuitæ mensuram alteram, e regione turris magnæ prominentis usque ad murum templi.
verses.english: After him, the Tekoites repaired another section, from the great projecting tower all the way to the wall of the Temple.

verses.latin: Supra portam equorum ædificaverunt sacerdotes, unusquisque e regione domus suæ.
verses.english: Above the Horse Gate, the priests rebuilt their sections, each working opposite his own house.

verses.latin: Post eos ædificavit Sadoc filius Emmer e regione domus suæ: et post eum ædificavit Semeia filius Secheniæ custos Portæ orientalis.
verses.english: After them, Zadok, the son of Immer, rebuilt his section opposite his own house. And after him, Shemaiah, the son of Shecaniah, the keeper of the East Gate, rebuilt his section.

verses.latin: Post eum ædificavit Anania filius Selemia, et Hanon filius Seleph sextus, mensuram alteram: post eum ædificavit Mosollam filius Barachiæ e regione gazophylacii sui.
verses.english: After him, Hananiah, the son of Shelemiah, and Hanun, the sixth son of Zalaph, rebuilt another section. After him, Meshullam, the son of Berechiah, rebuilt his section opposite his own chamber (or treasury).

verses.latin: Post eum ædificavit Melchias filius aurificis usque ad domum Nathinæorum, et negotiatorum, e regione Portæ judicialis, et usque ad cœnaculum anguli.
verses.english: After him, Malchijah, one of the goldsmiths, rebuilt his section as far as the house of the Nethinim (temple servants) and the merchants, working opposite the Muster Gate (or Inspection Gate), and all the way to the upper room at the corner.

verses.latin: Et inter cœnaculum anguli et Portam Gregis ædificaverunt aurifices et negotiatores.
verses.english: Between the upper room at the corner and the Sheep Gate, the goldsmiths and the merchants rebuilt their sections.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, ut audiret Sanaballat quod ædificaremus murum, iratus est valde: et commotus nimis irrisit Judæos.
verses.english: Now it came to pass that when Sanballat heard that we were rebuilding the wall, he became very angry and greatly disturbed. He then began to mock the Jews.

verses.latin: Et dixit coram fratribus suis, et optimatibus Samaritanorum: Quid Judæi infirmissimi faciunt? numquid dimittent eos principes? numquid sacrificabunt? numquid complebunt in una die? numquid ædificabunt de lapidibus congeriem pulveris, qui combusti sunt?
verses.english: He then spoke before his brethren and the leading men of Samaria, saying: 'What are these feeble Jews doing? Will their leaders permit them to continue? Will they offer sacrifices? Will they finish the work in a single day? Will they revive the stones from these heaps of burnt rubbish?'

verses.latin: Tobias quoque Ammanites, juxta eum, ait: Ædificent, si ascenderit vulpis, transiliet murum eorum lapideum.
verses.english: Tobiah the Ammonite, who was standing beside him, also spoke, saying: 'Even if they build, if a fox goes up on their wall, it will break down their stone wall!'

verses.latin: Audi, Deus noster, quia facti sumus despectui: converte opprobrium super caput eorum, et da eos in despectionem in terra captivitatis.
verses.english: Hear us, O our God, because we have become an object of contempt! Turn their scorn back upon their own heads, and deliver them into disgrace in the land of their captivity.

verses.latin: Et ne operias iniquitatem eorum, et peccatum eorum a facie tua non deleatur, quia irritaverunt te coram ædificantibus.
verses.english: Do not cover their iniquity, and let their sin not be blotted out from before Your sight, because they have provoked You in the presence of those who are rebuilding.

verses.latin: Itaque ædificavimus murum, et totus ædificatus est usque ad medietatem: et provocatum est cor populi ad operandum.
verses.english: So we rebuilt the wall, and the entire wall was joined together up to half of its intended height. For the people had a mind to work, and their hearts were fully committed to the task.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, ut audiret Sanaballat, et Tobias, et Arabes, et Ammanitæ, et Azotii, quod obducta esset cicatrix muri Jerusalem, et quod cœpissent interrupta concludi, irati sunt nimis.
verses.english: Now it came to pass that when Sanballat, Tobiah, the Arabs, the Ammonites, and the Ashdodites heard that the damage to the walls of Jerusalem was being closed up, and that the breaches had begun to be repaired, they became exceedingly angry.

verses.latin: Et convenerunt omnes pariter ut venirent, et pugnarent contra Jerusalem, et nuntiarent jacturam.
verses.english: And they all conspired together to come and fight against Jerusalem, intending to cause confusion and disrupt the work.

verses.latin: Factum est autem ut audiret Sanaballat quod ædificaremus murum, iratus est valde: et commotus nimis irrisit Judæos,
verses.english: It happened that when Sanballat heard we were rebuilding the wall, he became extremely angry. He was deeply provoked and mocked the Jewish people.

verses.latin: et dixit coram fratribus suis et optimatibus Samaritanorum: Quid Judæi imbecilli faciunt? numquid dimittent eos gentes? numquid sacrificabunt? numquid complebunt in una die? numquid ædificabunt de lapidibus pulveris, qui combusti sunt?
verses.english: He then spoke before his brothers and the leaders of the Samaritans, saying: "What are these weak Jews doing? Will the nations leave them alone? Will they offer sacrifices? Will they finish the work in a single day? Will they build from the dusty stones that have been burned?"

verses.latin: Sed et Tobias Ammanites juxta eum: Ait, Ædificent: si ascenderit vulpis, transiliet murum eorum lapideum.
verses.english: Now Tobiah the Ammonite was standing next to him, and he added: "Let them build! If even a fox goes up, it will jump over their stone wall."

verses.latin: Audi Deus noster, quia facti sumus despectui: converte opprobrium super caput eorum, et da eos in rapinam in terra captivitatis.
verses.english: Nehemiah prayed: "Hear us, O our God, because we have become despised. Turn their scorn back onto their own heads, and hand them over as plunder in a land of captivity—a land where they themselves are enslaved."

verses.latin: Et ne operias iniquitatem eorum, et peccatum eorum a facie tua non deleatur: quia conturbauerunt ædificantes.
verses.english: "Do not cover their iniquity, and let their sin not be erased from Your sight, because they have deeply disturbed those who are building."

verses.latin: Igitur ædificavimus murum, et junximus totum murum usque ad medietatem ejus: et animum revocavit populus ad operandum.
verses.english: So we rebuilt the wall, and the entire wall was joined up to half its original height. The people had returned their hearts and minds fully to the work.

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum audisset Sanaballat, et Tobias, et Arabes, et Ammanitæ, et Azotii, quod obducta esset cicatrix muri Jerusalem, et quod cœpissent interrupta concludi: irati sunt vehementer.
verses.english: Now it came to pass that when Sanballat, Tobiah, the Arabs, the Ammonites, and the Ashdodites heard that the extensive damage to the wall of Jerusalem was being repaired and that the broken places had begun to be closed up, they became exceedingly angry.

verses.latin: Et congregati sunt omnes pariter ut venirent, et pugnarent contra Jerusalem, et nuntiarent nequiter.
verses.english: They all gathered together with a common purpose: to come and fight against Jerusalem, intending to spread malicious rumors and cause great trouble.

verses.latin: Et oravimus Deum nostrum, et posuimus custodes super murum die ac nocte contra eos.
verses.english: But we prayed to our God, and we also set up guards on the wall, day and night, against these enemies.

verses.latin: Dixit autem Judas: Imminuta est fortitudo portantis, et humus plurima est, et non poterimus ædificare murum.
verses.english: Meanwhile, the people of Judah said among themselves: "The strength of those carrying loads is diminished. There is too much rubble, and we will not be able to finish building the wall."

verses.latin: Et dixerunt hostes nostri: Non sciant, nec intelligant, donec veniamus in medio eorum, et occidamus eos, et cessare faciamus opus.
verses.english: And our enemies said: "They will not know or understand our plan until we come right into their midst, kill them, and make the work stop completely."

verses.latin: Factum est autem, ut venirent Judæi qui habitabant juxta eos, et dicerent nobis per decem vices, ex omnibus locis in quibus morabantur, super nos.
verses.english: It also happened that the Jews who lived near them came and told us ten times, from all the places where they lived, warnings that the enemies were coming to attack us.

verses.latin: Propterea ordinavi de infimis loci, post murum per circuitum, in gradibus, et posui populum cum gladiis suis, et lanceis, et arcubus.
verses.english: Therefore, I stationed people in the lowest parts of the area, behind the wall, at strategic intervals around it. I placed the people there with their swords, spears, and bows.

verses.latin: Et vidi, et surrexi, et locutus sum ad optimates, et ad magistratus, et ad reliquos de populo: Nolite timere a facie eorum: Domini magni et terribilis mementote, et pugnate pro fratribus vestris, filiis vestris, et filiabus vestris, et uxoribus vestris, et domibus vestris.
verses.english: And I saw their fear, so I stood up and spoke to the nobles, the officials, and the rest of the people: "Do not be afraid of them. Remember the Lord, Who is great and awesome, and fight for your brothers, your sons and your daughters, your wives, and your homes."

verses.latin: Factum est autem, cum audissent inimici nostri nuntiatum esse nobis, quod dissipasset Deus consilium eorum, reversi sumus omnes ad murum, unusquisque ad opus suum.
verses.english: So it happened that when our enemies heard it had been reported to us, and that God had thwarted their evil plan, we all returned to the wall, each man to his own work.

verses.latin: Et factum est a die illa, media pars juvenum eorum faciebant opus, et media pars tenebat lanceas, et scuta, et arcus, et loricas: et principes post eos in omni domo Juda.
verses.english: From that day onward, half of the young men among our people were doing the construction work, and the other half held spears, shields, bows, and armor. The leaders were stationed behind all the house of Judah to supervise.

verses.latin: Ædificantium murum, et portantium onera, et imponentium: una manu faciebat opus, et altera tenebat gladium.
verses.english: Those who were building the wall, and those who were carrying burdens and loading them onto the wall, worked with one hand and held a sword in the other.

verses.latin: Et ædificantes singuli gladios suos accincti erant lumbis suis. Et ædificabant, et clangebant tuba juxta me.
verses.english: And each of the builders wore his sword strapped to his side as he built. The trumpeter stood next to me, ready to sound the alarm.

verses.latin: Et dixi ad optimates, et ad magistratus, et ad reliquos de populo: Opus multiplex est, et latum est, et nos separati sumus in muro, procul alter ab altero.
verses.english: Then I said to the nobles, the officials, and the rest of the people: "The work is extensive and spread out, and we are separated on the wall, far from one another."

verses.latin: In loco quocumque audieritis vocem tubæ, illuc concurrite ad nos: Deus noster pugnabit pro nobis.
verses.english: "Wherever you hear the sound of the trumpet, rush to us there. Our God will fight for us."

verses.latin: Et ipsi faciebant opus, et media pars eorum tenebat lanceas ab ascensu auroræ, donec egrederentur sidera.
verses.english: So they continued the work, and half of them held spears from the first appearance of dawn until the stars came out in the evening.

verses.latin: In illo quoque tempore dixi populo: Unusquisque cum puero suo maneat in medio Jerusalem, et sint nobis vices die ac nocte.
verses.english: At that same time, I also said to the people: "Let each man and his servant remain within Jerusalem, so that they can be our guards both day and night."

verses.latin: Ego autem et fratres mei, et pueri mei, et custodes qui erant mecum, non deponebamus vestimenta nostra: unusquisque tantum nudabatur ad lavandum.
verses.english: As for me, my brothers, my personal servants, and the guards who were with me, we did not take off our clothes—each man only removed them for washing.

verses.latin: Et factus est clamor populi, et uxorum ejus, magnus adversus fratres suos Judæos.
verses.english: Then a great outcry began among the people, and their wives joined them in raising their voices against their fellow Jewish brothers.

verses.latin: Et fuerunt qui dicerent: Filii nostri, et filiæ nostræ multæ sunt: accipiamus frumentum in pretio, et comedamus, et vivamus.
verses.english: Some of the people began to say: 'We have so many sons and daughters, and we need grain for them to eat and for us all to survive.'

verses.latin: Et fuerunt qui dicerent: Agros nostros, et vineas nostras, et domos nostras opponamus, et accipiamus frumentum in fame.
verses.english: Other people said: 'We are being forced to pledge our fields, our vineyards, and our houses as collateral to get grain because of this severe hunger.'

verses.latin: Et alii dicebant: Mutuo sumpsimus pecuniam in tributa regis, agris nostris, et vineis nostris.
verses.english: And yet other people were saying: 'We had to borrow money using our fields and vineyards as collateral just to pay the king's taxes.'

verses.latin: Et nunc caro nostra sicut caro fratrum nostrorum, et filii nostri sicut filii eorum: ecce nos curvamus filios nostros et filias nostras in servitutem, et de filiabus nostris sunt famulæ, nec habemus unde redimamus eos, agros nostros et vineas nostras alii possident.
verses.english: And now, though we are of the same flesh as our brothers, and our children are just like their children, we are forced to subjugate our own sons and daughters into slavery. Some of our daughters are already serving as female slaves, and we have no way to buy them back, because other people have taken possession of our fields and our vineyards.

verses.latin: Et iratus sum nimis cum audissem clamorem eorum secundum verba hæc.
verses.english: And I became extremely angry when I heard their desperate outcry and these specific grievances.

verses.latin: Et cogitavi in corde meo, et increpavi optimates et magistratus: et dixi eis: Usuras exigitis singuli a fratribus vestris? Et congregavi contra eos multitudinem magnam:
verses.english: I considered the situation carefully within my own heart, and then I publicly rebuked the nobles and the officials. I asked them: 'Are each of you truly demanding excessive interest from your own brothers?' Afterwards, I called a large public assembly to confront them.

verses.latin: et dixi eis: Nos, ut scitis, redemimus fratres nostros Judæos, qui venditi fuerant gentibus, quantum potuimus: et vos nunc venditis fratres vestros, et venduntur nobis? Et siluerunt, nec invenerunt quid responderent.
verses.english: I also spoke to them, saying: 'You all know that we have made every effort to buy back our Jewish brothers who were sold into slavery to foreign nations. And now, you yourselves are selling your own brothers, forcing us to buy them back again into our own community?' They remained completely silent, unable to find any words to justify themselves.

verses.latin: Et addidi, dicens: Non est bona res, quam facitis: quare non in timore Dei nostri ambulatis, ne exprobret nobis gentibus inimica nostra?
verses.english: Then I continued, saying: 'What you are doing is absolutely not right! Why are you not living your lives in the reverent fear of our God, so that our enemy nations do not have reason to mock and condemn us?'

verses.latin: Et ego, et fratres mei, et servi mei mutuavimus pecuniam, et frumentum multum populo: non repetamus ab eis usuras istas.
verses.english: Even I, my brothers, and my servants have generously lent both money and much grain to these very people. Therefore, let us now all agree to stop demanding this excessive interest from them.

verses.latin: Reddite eis hodie agros suos, et vineas suas, et oliveta sua, et domos suas: et centesimam pecuniæ, frumenti, vini, et olei, quam soletis exigere ab eis, date illis.
verses.english: Today, you must return to them their fields, their vineyards, their olive groves, and their houses. Furthermore, you must also give back to them the one-hundredth part of the money, grain, wine, and oil—which represents the excessive interest you have been accustomed to demanding from them.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Reddemus, et nihil ab eis quæremus: sic faciemus ut loqueris. Et vocavi sacerdotes, et adjuravi eos ut facerent juxta quod dixeram.
verses.english: And the nobles replied: 'We will restore everything, and we will demand nothing further from them; we will indeed do exactly as you have spoken.' So, I called for the priests and had them administer an oath, ensuring that the nobles would do precisely what I had instructed.

verses.latin: Insuper et sinum meum excussi, et dixi: Sic excutiat Deus omnem virum qui non impleverit verbum hoc, de domo sua, et de laboribus suis: sic excutiatur, et vacuus fiat. Et dixit universa multitudo: Amen. Et laudaverunt Deum. Fecit ergo populus sicut dictum erat.
verses.english: Then, as an additional warning, I shook out the fold of my garment, and I declared: 'May God likewise shake out every man who fails to fulfill this solemn promise, stripping him of his house and all his possessions derived from his labor! May he be completely emptied and left with nothing!' The entire assembly responded with 'Amen!' and then they praised God. So, the people who had made the promise carried out what had been spoken.

verses.latin: A die autem qua præceperat mihi rex ut essem dux in terra Juda, ab anno vicesimo, et usque ad annum trigesimum secundum Artaxerxis regis, annis duodecim, ego et fratres mei annonas non comedimus ducum.
verses.english: Now, from the very day that the king appointed me to serve as governor over the land of Judah—which spanned from the twentieth year to the thirty-second year of King Artaxerxes, a full twelve years—neither I nor my brothers ever took the food allowance or salary that was due to governors.

verses.latin: Prædecessores autem mei duces graves fuerant populo: et acceperant ab eis in pane, et vino, et pecunia, pro singulis diebus, quadraginta siclos argenti: sed et servi eorum dominabantur populi. Ego autem non feci ita, propter timorem Dei.
verses.english: However, the governors who were before me had been a severe burden to the people. They continually took from them forty shekels of silver daily, along with generous provisions of bread, wine, and money. Even their own servants were allowed to domineer over the people. But I, for my part, did not act in this way, because of my reverent fear of God.

verses.latin: Quin potius in opere muri hujus ædificavi: et agrum non emi, et omnes servi mei pariter erant ad opus.
verses.english: Instead, I threw myself into the work of rebuilding this wall. I did not purchase any land for myself, and all my servants were likewise engaged in the work alongside everyone else.

verses.latin: Centum quoque quinquaginta Judæi et magistratus erant ad mensam meam, exceptis his qui veniebant ad nos de gentibus quæ in circuitu nostro sunt.
verses.english: Moreover, a hundred and fifty Jewish people and officials regularly ate at my table, in addition to those who came to us from the Gentile nations residing around our borders.

verses.latin: Cibus autem meus per singulos dies, bos unus, arietum sex, excipiebantur: aves quoque dabantur mihi, et interdiu semel vinum in multa varietate: insuper et vestem ducum non quæsivi, quia aggravata erat servitus populi hujus.
verses.english: Even though my daily provision included one ox, six choice sheep, and various birds were also supplied to me, along with a wide selection of wine served once each day—despite all this abundance, I did not demand the official robes or lavish clothing due to governors. This was because the burden of servitude resting upon these people was already exceedingly heavy.

verses.latin: Memento mei, Deus meus, in bonum, juxta omnia quæ feci populo huic.
verses.english: Remember me, O my God, for good, in consideration of all the benevolent actions I have carried out for this people.

verses.latin: Factus est autem clamor populi et uxorum ejus multus adversus fratres suos Judæos.
verses.english: A great cry arose from the people, and even from their wives, against their own Jewish brothers.

verses.latin: Et erant qui dicerent: Filios nostros et filias nostras multas habemus: emamus triticum, et comedamus, et vivamus.
verses.english: And there were some who said: "We have many sons and daughters, and we must buy wheat so that we can eat and live."

verses.latin: Et erant alii qui dicerent: Agris nostris, et vineis nostris, et domibus nostris opponamus pecuniam, et accipiamus triticum in fame.
verses.english: And others said: "We must mortgage our fields, our vineyards, and our houses to get money, so we can buy wheat because of the famine."

verses.latin: Et alii dicebant: Mutuo sumpsimus pecuniam in tributa regis, dedimus agros nostros et vineas nostras.
verses.english: And still others said: "We had to borrow money to pay the king's taxes, and we had to pledge our fields and our vineyards as collateral."

verses.latin: Et nunc sicut carnes fratrum nostrorum, sic carnes nostræ sunt: et sicut filii eorum, ita et filii nostri: ecce nos obsequio addicimus filios nostros et filias nostras, et de filiabus nostris sunt famulæ, nec habemus quicquam, quia agri nostri et vineæ nostræ alteri debentur.
verses.english: "And now, our flesh is like the flesh of our brothers—we are all human beings, yet our children are no different from theirs. Look, we are forced to sell our sons and daughters into slavery to pay our debts. Some of our daughters are already enslaved as servants. We have nothing left, because our fields and vineyards are already taken by others to whom we owe money."

verses.latin: Et iratus sum nimis cum audissem clamorem eorum secundum verba hæc.
verses.english: I, Nehemiah, became exceedingly angry when I heard their outcry and these words.

verses.latin: Cogitavi mecum, et increpavi optimates et magistratus: et dixi eis: Usuras exigitis singuli a fratribus vestris. Et congregavi contra eos multitudinem magnam, et dixi eis:
verses.english: I thought about it carefully, and then I rebuked the nobles and the officials, saying to them: "You are each demanding usury—excessive interest—from your own brothers!" Then I gathered a large assembly against them, and I spoke to them further:

verses.latin: Nos, ut scitis, emimus fratres nostros Judæos qui venditi fuerant gentibus, secundum possibilitatem nostram: et vos nunc venditis fratres vestros, ut emantur a nobis? Et siluerunt, nec invenerunt quid responderent.
verses.english: "We, as you know, have redeemed our Jewish brothers who had been sold to the Gentiles, doing so according to our ability to pay. And now you yourselves are selling your own brothers, so that we have to buy them back again?" They were silent, having no answer to give.

verses.latin: Et dixi eis: Non est bona res quam facitis. Quare non in timore Dei nostri ambulatis, ne exprobret nobis opprobrium gentium inimicarum nostrarum?
verses.english: And I said to them: "What you are doing is not good. Why do you not walk in the fear of our God, so that you do not bring reproach upon us from our Gentile enemies?"

verses.latin: Et ego, et fratres mei, et servi mei, mutuavimus pecuniam et frumentum: non repetamus ab eis usuras istas?
verses.english: "I myself, along with my brothers and my servants, have also lent them money and grain. Let us now release them from these debts of usury."

verses.latin: Reddite eis hodie agros suos, et vineas suas, et olivas suas, et domos suas: et centesimam pecuniæ, frumenti, vini et olei, quam ab eis exigere soletis, date pro illis.
verses.english: "Return to them this very day their fields, their vineyards, their olive groves, and their houses. And also release them from the hundredth part of the money, grain, wine, and oil that you customarily demand from them as interest."

verses.latin: Et dixerunt: Reddemus, et nihil ab eis quæremus: sic faciemus ut loqueris. Et vocavi sacerdotes, et adjuravi eos ut facerent juxta verbum hoc.
verses.english: And they said: "We will restore everything, and we will demand nothing from them. We will do exactly as you say." Then I called the priests and made them swear an oath that they would act according to this promise.

verses.latin: Insuper et sinum meum excussi, et dixi: Sic excutiat Deus omnem virum qui non impleverit verbum hoc, de domo sua, et de laboribus suis sic excutiatur, et vacuus fiat. Et dixit universa multitudo: Amen. Et laudaverunt Deum. Fecit ergo populus sicut dictum erat.
verses.english: Furthermore, I shook out the fold of my garment and said: "Thus may God shake out from his house and from his possessions every man who does not keep this promise. May he be shaken out and emptied!" And the entire assembly said: "Amen!" And they praised God. So the people did as they had promised.

verses.latin: A die autem qua præceperat mihi rex ut essem dux in terra Juda, ab anno vicesimo usque ad annum trigesimum secundum Artaxerxis regis, annis duodecim, ego et fratres mei annonas meas et fratrum meorum non comedimus.
verses.english: Now, from the day that the king commanded me to be their governor in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year until the thirty-second year of King Artaxerxes—a total of twelve years—neither I nor my brothers ate the food rations that were due to me as governor.

verses.latin: Prædecessores autem mei duces primi, gravaverant populum: et acceperant ab eis in pane et vino, præter quadraginta siclos argenti: sed et servi eorum dominabantur populi. Ego autem non feci ita propter timorem Dei.
verses.english: In contrast, the former governors who were before me had burdened the people severely. They had taken from them bread and wine, in addition to forty shekels of silver. Moreover, even their servants lorded it over the people. But I did not do so, because I acted out of reverence for God.

verses.latin: Quin potius in opere muri hujus ædificavi, et agrum non emi: et omnes servi mei pariter erant ad opus.
verses.english: Instead, I dedicated myself to the work on this wall, building it with my own hands, and I did not purchase any land for myself. All my servants also worked alongside everyone else on the wall.

verses.latin: Judæorum quoque et magistratuum centum quinquaginta viri, et qui veniebant ad nos de gentibus quæ in circuitu nostro sunt, erant super mensam meam.
verses.english: Furthermore, one hundred and fifty men, comprising Jews and officials, along with those who came to us from the surrounding Gentile nations, regularly ate at my table.

verses.latin: Et parabatur mihi per dies singulos bos unus, arietes sex electi, exceptis volatilibus: et semel in diebus decem omnis generis vinum, et multo alia: et tamen annonas ducatus mei non quæsivi: quoniam graviter premebat fames populum.
verses.english: And for me, each day, one ox was prepared, along with six chosen sheep, not counting the poultry. And every ten days, wine of all kinds, and many other provisions, were supplied. Yet, despite all this, I never demanded the governor's allowance that was due to me, because the famine was pressing heavily upon the people.

verses.latin: Memento mei, Deus meus, in bonum, juxta omnia quæ feci populo huic.
verses.english: Remember me, my God, for good, because of all that I have done for this people.

verses.latin: Factum est autem, audientibus Sanaballat et Thobia et Gosem Arabi, et ceteris inimicis nostris, quoniam aedificassem ego murum, et non esset in eo superducta jam porta: miserunt ad me Sanaballat et Gosem, dicentes: Veni, et conveniamus in viculis in campo Ono.
verses.english: It happened that Sanballat, Tobiah, Geshem the Arab, and our other enemies heard that I had completed rebuilding the city wall, and that there were no gaps left in it for a gate. So, Sanballat and Geshem sent a message to me, saying: 'Come, let us meet together in the villages on the plain of Ono.'

verses.latin: Et cogitabant facere mihi malum.
verses.english: They were plotting to harm me.

verses.latin: Et misi ad eos nuntios, dicens: Opus magnum ego facio, et non possum descendere: ne forte, cum deseruero illud, intermittatur opus.
verses.english: I sent messengers back to them, saying: 'I am doing a great work, and I cannot come down. If I leave this work to meet you, it will be interrupted.'

verses.latin: Miserunt itaque ad me secundum verbum per quatuor vices: et respondi eis juxta priorem sermonem.
verses.english: So they sent the same message to me four times, and each time I responded to them with the same answer.

verses.latin: Et misit ad me Sanaballat quintam vicem puerum suum, epistolam habentem apertam in manu sua,
verses.english: Then, on the fifth time, Sanballat sent his servant to me with an open letter in his hand.

verses.latin: scriptumque erat in ea: In gentibus auditum est, et Gosem dixit, quod tu et Judaei cogitetis rebellare, et propter hoc aedifices murum, et levare velis te regem, juxta sermones istos.
verses.english: It was written in the letter: 'It has been reported among the nations, and Geshem confirms it, that you and the Judeans are plotting to rebel. That is why you are rebuilding the wall, and you intend to make yourself king, according to these rumors.'

verses.latin: Et prophetas supposuisti, qui praedicent de te in Jerusalem, dicentes: Rex est in Judaea. Nunc ergo auditum facio regi juxta sermones istos. Veni ergo, et ineamus consilium simul.
verses.english: 'Furthermore, you have appointed prophets to proclaim concerning you in Jerusalem, saying: “There is a king in Judea!” Now, therefore, I am reporting these matters to the king. So come now, let us meet and discuss this together.'

verses.latin: Et misi ad eum, dicens: Non est factum secundum sermones istos, quos loqueris: de corde enim tuo tu componis ex his.
verses.english: But I sent word back to him, saying: 'None of these things you are talking about are actually happening; you are simply inventing these things from your own mind.'

verses.latin: Omnes enim hi terrere nos volebant, cogitantes quod cessarent manus nostrae ab opere, et quiesceremus: propter hoc magis confortavi manus meas.
verses.english: For all of them wanted to frighten us, thinking that our hands would become weak from the work, and that we would cease our labor. Because of this, I strengthened my resolve even more.

verses.latin: Et ingressus sum domum Samaiae filii Dalaiae filii Metabeel secreto. Qui ait: Transeamus, et ingrediamur in templum Dei, et claudamus portas templi: quia veniunt interficere te, et nocte venturi sunt ad occidendum te.
verses.english: Then I went into the house of Shemaiah, son of Delaiah, son of Mehetabel, who was confined at home. He said: 'Let us go and shut ourselves inside the temple of God, and close the temple doors; for they are coming to kill you, and they will surely come at night to murder you.'

verses.latin: Et dixi: Num quisquam similis mei fugit? et quis est qui, talis qualis ego sum, ingrediatur templum, et vivat? non ingrediar.
verses.english: But I said: 'Should a man like me flee? And who is there, a man like me, who would enter the temple to save his life? I will not go in.'

verses.latin: Et intellexi quod Deus non misisset eum, sed quasi prophetiam locutum fuisset ad me, et Thobias et Sanaballat conduxissent eum.
verses.english: Then I understood that God had not sent him, but that he had spoken this 'prophecy' to me because Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.

verses.latin: Ut terrerent me, et peccarem, et haberent malum quod exprobrarent mihi.
verses.english: They had hired him to intimidate me, to make me sin by seeking refuge in the temple, and then they would have a scandal to publicly accuse me with.

verses.latin: Memento mei, Deus meus, pro Tobia et Sanaballat juxta opera eorum talia: sed et Noadiae prophetae, et ceterorum prophetarum qui terrebant me.
verses.english: Remember them, O my God, for these actions of Tobiah and Sanballat. Also remember the prophetess Noadiah and the other prophets who kept trying to frighten me.

verses.latin: Consummatus est autem murus vigesimo quinto die mensis Elul, quinquaginta duobus diebus.
verses.english: So the entire wall was completed on the twenty-fifth day of the month Elul, which was within fifty-two days of starting the work.

verses.latin: Factum est ergo, cum audissent omnes inimici nostri, et vidissent universae gentes quae erant in circuitu nostro, et concidissent intra semetipsos: scierunt quoniam a Deo factum esset opus hoc.
verses.english: When all our enemies heard about it, and all the nations around us saw it, they were humbled and realized that this work had been accomplished by God Himself.

verses.latin: Sed et in diebus illis multae optimatum Judaeorum epistolae mittebantur ad Tobiam, et a Tobia veniebant ad eos.
verses.english: Moreover, in those days, many letters from the nobles of Judah were being sent to Tobiah, and letters from Tobiah were coming to them in return.

verses.latin: Multi enim in Judaea juramento illi juncti erant, quia gener erat Sechia filii Area, et filia ejus Maasal, filia Mosollam filii Barachiae, acceperat.
verses.english: For many in Judah were bound to him by oath, because he was the son-in-law of Shecaniah, son of Arah. And his son Jehohanan had married the daughter of Meshullam, son of Berechiah, so they were connected by family alliances.

verses.latin: Sed et de sermonibus ejus loquebantur ad me, et verba mea nuntiabant illi: et Tobías mittebat epistolas ut terreret me.
verses.english: They even spoke of Tobiah's good deeds to me, and they reported my words back to him. Meanwhile, Tobiah kept sending letters to try and frighten me.

verses.latin: Postquam autem aedificatus est murus, et statui ostia, et recensui janitores, et cantores, et levitas:
verses.english: After the city wall was rebuilt, I set up the doors in the gates. I then organized and registered the gatekeepers, the singers, and the Levites.

verses.latin: praecepi Hanani fratri meo, et Hananiae principi domus Jerusalem (ipse enim quasi vir fidelis, et timens Deum plus ceteris erat) :
verses.english: I put my brother Hanani, along with Hananiah, the commander of the Jerusalem fortress, in charge of the city. Hananiah was a man of great integrity, who feared God more than most people.

verses.latin: et dixi eis: Non aperiantur portae Jerusalem usque ad ortum solis: et cum adhuc essent illi, clauderent et oppilarent. Et statui custodes de habitatoribus Jerusalem, singulos per vices suas, et unumquemque contra domum suam.
verses.english: I told them: 'Do not open the gates of Jerusalem until the sun is high in the sky. And while the guards are still on duty, they are to close and bar the gates.' I also appointed guards from among the residents of Jerusalem, with each one serving in his turn and standing watch over the area directly in front of his own house.

verses.latin: Civitas autem lata erat nimis et grandis: et populus parvus in medio ejus, et domus non aedificatae.
verses.english: The city itself was very large and spacious, but there were few people living in it, and many houses still had not been rebuilt.

verses.latin: Inluminavit autem Deus cor meum ut congregarem principes, et magistratus, et plebem, et recensui eos: et inveni librum generationis eorum qui ascenderant primum, et inventum est in eo scriptum:
verses.english: Then God put it into my heart to gather the nobles, the officials, and the common people so I could register them by their family lines. I found the record of the family lines of those who had returned first from exile, and this is what was written in it:

verses.latin: Isti sunt filii provinciae, qui ascenderunt de captivitate, transmigratonis quos transtulerat Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et reversi sunt in Jerusalem, et in Judam, unusquisque in civitate sua.
verses.english: These are the people of the province who came up from the captivity of the exile, whom Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, had taken away. They returned to Jerusalem and to Judah, each to his own town.

verses.latin: Qui venerunt cum Zorobabel, Josue, Nehemias, Azarias, Raamias, Nahamani, Mardochæus, Bilsan, Mespharath, Beguai, Nahum, Baana. Numerus virorum populi Israel:
verses.english: Those who came with Zerubbabel were Jeshua, Nehemiah, Azariah, Raamiah, Nahamani, Mordecai, Bilshan, Mispereth, Bigvai, Nahum, and Baanah. The number of the men of the people of Israel was as follows:

verses.latin: filii Pharos, duo millia centum septuaginta duo.
verses.english: The descendants of Parosh: two thousand one hundred seventy-two.

verses.latin: Filii Saphatia, trecenti septuaginta duo.
verses.english: The descendants of Shephatiah: three hundred seventy-two.

verses.latin: Filii Area, sexcenti quinquaginta duo.
verses.english: The descendants of Arah: six hundred fifty-two.

verses.latin: Filii Phaath Moab de filiis Josue et Joab, duo millia octingenti decem et octo.
verses.english: The descendants of Pahath-Moab, through the line of Jeshua and Joab: two thousand eight hundred eighteen.

verses.latin: Filii Ælam, mille ducenti quinquaginta quatuor.
verses.english: The descendants of Elam: one thousand two hundred fifty-four.

verses.latin: Filii Zethua, octingenti quadraginta quinque.
verses.english: The descendants of Zattu: eight hundred forty-five.

verses.latin: Filii Zachai, septingenti sexaginta.
verses.english: The descendants of Zaccai: seven hundred sixty.

verses.latin: Filii Bannui, sexcenti quadraginta octo.
verses.english: The descendants of Binnui: six hundred forty-eight.

verses.latin: Filii Bebai, sexcenti viginti octo.
verses.english: The descendants of Bebai: six hundred twenty-eight.

verses.latin: Filii Azgad, duo millia trecenti viginti duo.
verses.english: The descendants of Azgad: two thousand three hundred twenty-two.

verses.latin: Filii Adonicam, sexcenti sexaginta septem.
verses.english: The descendants of Adonikam: six hundred sixty-seven.

verses.latin: Filii Beguai, duo millia sexaginta septem.
verses.english: The descendants of Bigvai: two thousand sixty-seven.

verses.latin: Filii Adin, sexcenti quinquaginta quinque.
verses.english: The descendants of Adin: six hundred fifty-five.

verses.latin: Filii Ater, filii Ezechia, nonaginta octo.
verses.english: The descendants of Ater, through Hezekiah: ninety-eight.

verses.latin: Filii Hasum, trecenti viginti octo.
verses.english: The descendants of Hashum: three hundred twenty-eight.

verses.latin: Filii Besai, trecenti viginti quatuor.
verses.english: The descendants of Bezai: three hundred twenty-four.

verses.latin: Filii Hareph, centum duodecim.
verses.english: The descendants of Hariph: one hundred twelve.

verses.latin: Filii Gabaon, nonaginta quinque.
verses.english: The descendants of Gibeon: ninety-five.

verses.latin: Filii Bethlehem, et Netupha, centum octoginta octo.
verses.english: The men of Bethlehem and Netophah: one hundred eighty-eight.

verses.latin: Viri Anathoth, centum viginti octo.
verses.english: The men of Anathoth: one hundred twenty-eight.

verses.latin: Viri Bethazmoth, quadraginta duo.
verses.english: The men of Beth-Azmaveth: forty-two.

verses.latin: Viri Cariathiarim, Cephira, et Beroth, septingenti quadraginta tres.
verses.english: The men of Kiriath-Jearim, Chephirah, and Beeroth: seven hundred forty-three.

verses.latin: Viri Rama, et Gabaa, sexcenti viginti unus.
verses.english: The men of Ramah and Geba: six hundred twenty-one.
