verses.english: After the wall was finished, and I had set up the city gates, I then appointed the gatekeepers, the singers, and the Levites for their duties.

verses.latin: praecepi Chanani fratri meo, et Ananiae principi domus Jerusalem (quoniam ipse quasi vir verax erat, et timens Deum plus ceteris):
verses.english: I gave orders to my brother Hanani, and to Hananiah, the commander of the fortress of Jerusalem—because he was a trustworthy man, and feared God more than anyone else there.

verses.latin: et dixi eis: Non aperiantur portae Jerusalem usque ad solis calorem: et cum adhuc illi astarent, claudant, et obstringant: et ponant custodes de habitatoribus Jerusalem, singulos per vices suas, et unumquemque contra domum suam.
verses.english: And I told them: 'Do not open the gates of Jerusalem until the sun's full heat has arrived. While the guards are still on duty, they are to close and bar the gates tightly. Also, appoint guards from the citizens of Jerusalem, each for his own shift, and each one standing guard opposite his own house.'

verses.latin: Civitas autem erat lata nimis, et grandis: et populus parvus in medio ejus, et domus non aedificatae. Et dedit Deus in corde meo, et congregavi optimates, et magistratus, et plebem ut recenserem eos: et inveni librum census eorum qui ascenderant primum, et inventum est in eo scriptum:
verses.english: Now the city itself was very large and expansive, but there were few people living within it, and many houses had not yet been rebuilt. God put it into my heart to gather the nobles, the officials, and the common people so I could register them. I found the register of those who had first returned from exile, and in it was written:

verses.latin: Hi sunt filii provinciae, qui ascenderunt de captivitate, transmigratiónis, quos transtulerat Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis, et reversi sunt in Jerusalem, et in Judaeam, unusquisque in civitatem suam.
verses.english: 'These are the descendants of the province who came up from the captivity, from the exile, whom Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, had carried away. They returned to Jerusalem and to Judea, each to his own city.'

verses.latin: Et convenerunt omnis populus quasi vir unus ad plateam quæ est ante portam aquarum: et dixerunt Esdrae scribæ ut afferret librum legis Moysi, quam præceperat Dominus Israëli.
verses.english: So all the people gathered as one, assembling in the public square that stood before the Water Gate. They asked Ezra the scribe to bring out the Book of the Law of Moses, which the Lord had commanded to Israel, for them to hear.

verses.latin: Attulit ergo Esdras sacerdos librum legis coram multitudine virorum, et mulierum, et omnium qui poterant intelligere, die prima mensis septimi.
verses.english: So Ezra the priest brought the Book of the Law before the assembly, including men, women, and all the children old enough to understand. He did this on the first day of the seventh month—the beginning of the civil year.

verses.latin: Et legit in eo aperte in platea quæ erat ante portam aquarum, de mane usque ad mediam diem, in conspectu virorum, et mulierum, et eorum qui intelligere poterant: et aures omnis populi erant intentæ ad librum.
verses.english: And Ezra read from the book aloud and clearly in the public square, before the Water Gate, from early morning until midday. He read in the presence of the men, women, and those children who were able to understand. The entire assembly listened with focused attention to the Book of the Law.

verses.latin: Stetit autem Esdras scriba super gradum ligneum, quem fecerat ad loquendum: et steterunt juxta eum Mathathias, et Sama, et Ania, et Uria, et Helcia, et Maasia, ad dexteram ejus: et ad sinistram Phadaia, Misaël, et Melchia, et Hasum, et Hasbadana, Zacharia, et Mosollam.
verses.english: Ezra the scribe stood on a wooden platform that had been built for the purpose of speaking to the assembly. Standing beside him on his right were Mattathiah, Shema, Anaiah, Uriah, Hilkiah, and Maaseiah. On his left stood Pedaiah, Mishael, Malchijah, Hashum, Hashbaddana, Zechariah, and Meshullam.

verses.latin: Et aperuit Esdras librum coram omni populo: (stabat enim super cunctis populis) et cum aperuisset eum, stetit omnis populus.
verses.english: Ezra then opened the Book of the Law in the sight of all the people, for he was standing on the platform above everyone. As soon as he opened it, all the people rose to their feet in reverence.

verses.latin: Et benedixit Esdras Domino Deo magno: et respondit omnis populus, Amen, Amen, sublevantes manus suas: et incurvati adoraverunt Dominum in faciem super terram.
verses.english: Ezra blessed the Lord, the great God of all. And all the people responded, 'Amen, Amen,' raising their hands in agreement and praise. Then, bowing their heads, they prostrated themselves with their faces to the ground and adored the Lord.

verses.latin: Porro Josue, et Bani, et Serebia, Jamin, Accub, Septhai, Odia, Maasia, Celita, Azarias, Jozabed, Hanan, Phalaia, Levitæ, silentium faciebant in populo ad audiendam legem: et omnis populus stabat.
verses.english: Then the Levites—Joshua, Bani, Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, and Pelaiah—ensured silence among the people so they could hear the Law. And all the people remained standing attentively.

verses.latin: Et legerunt in libro legis Dei distincte et aperte ad intelligendum: et intellexerunt cum legeretur.
verses.english: They read from the Book of the Law of God, clearly explaining its meaning so the people could understand what was being read. And as they read, the people comprehended the teachings.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Nehemias (ipse est Athersatha) et Esdras sacerdos et scriba, et Levitæ interpretantes universo populo: Dies sanctificatus est Domino Deo nostro, nolite lugere, et nolite flere. Flebat enim omnis populus cum audiret verba legis.
verses.english: Then Nehemiah, who was the governor, and Ezra the priest and scribe, along with the Levites who were instructing the people, said to everyone: 'This day is consecrated to the Lord our God. Do not mourn, and do not weep.' For all the people were weeping as they heard the words of the Law, realizing their past transgressions.

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Ite, comedite pinguia, et bibite mulsum, et mittite partem his qui non præparaverunt sibi: quia sanctus est dies Domini nostri, et nolite contristari: gaudium enim Domini est fortitudo nostra.
verses.english: And Nehemiah said to them: 'Go, enjoy rich foods and sweet drinks, and share some with those who have nothing prepared, for this is a holy day for our Lord. Do not be sorrowful, for the joy of the Lord is our strength and our protection.'

verses.latin: Et Levitæ silentium faciebant in omni populo, dicentes: Tacete, quia dies sanctus est, et nolite dolere.
verses.english: And the Levites quieted all the people, saying: 'Be silent, because this is a holy day. Do not grieve, but rejoice.'

verses.latin: Abiit ergo omnis populus ut comederet, et biberet, et mitteret partes, et gauderet lætitia magna: quia intellexerant verba quæ docuerat eos.
verses.english: So all the people went away to eat and to drink, and to share their provisions, and to rejoice with great gladness. They did this because they had understood the words that had been taught to them from the Law of God.

verses.latin: Et in die secundo convenerunt principes familiarum universi populi, sacerdotes, et Levitæ, ad Esdram scribam, ut interpretaretur eis super sermones legis.
verses.english: On the second day, the heads of the families of all the people, along with the priests and Levites, gathered with Ezra the scribe. They came so he could further explain the words of the Law to them, seeking deeper understanding.

verses.latin: Et invenerunt scriptum in lege, quod præceperat Dominus in manu Moysi, ut habitent filii Israël in tabernaculis in die solemni mensis septimi:
verses.english: And they found it written in the Law that the Lord had commanded through Moses, that the children of Israel should dwell in temporary shelters, or booths, during the solemn feast of the seventh month.

verses.latin: et ut prædicent, et divulgent vocem in cunctis urbibus suis, et in Jerusalem, dicentes: Egredimini in montem, et afferte frondes olivæ, et frondes ligni pulcherrimi, frondes myrti, et frondes palmæ, et frondes ligni nemorosi, ut fiant tabernacula, sicut scriptum est.
verses.english: And that they should proclaim and make known throughout all their cities, and especially in Jerusalem, saying: 'Go out to the hill country and bring branches of olive trees, and branches of beautiful trees, branches of myrtle, and branches of palm trees, and branches of leafy trees, so that you may make booths,' just as it is written in the Law.

verses.latin: Et egressus est populus, et attulerunt. Et fecerunt sibi tabernacula unusquisque in tecto domus suæ, et in atriis suis, et in atriis domus Dei, et in platea portæ aquarum, et in platea portæ Ephraim.
verses.english: So the people went out and brought the branches. And they made booths for themselves, each person on the roof of his house, and in their courtyards, and in the courtyards of the house of God, and in the public square by the Water Gate, and in the square by the Gate of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Fecerat ergo omnis ecclesia eorum, qui redierant de captivitate, tabernacula: et habitaverunt in tabernaculis: non enim fecerant a diebus Josue filii Nun taliter filii Israël usque ad diem illam: et fuit lætitia magna nimis.
verses.english: Thus, the entire congregation of those who had returned from captivity made booths and lived in them. Indeed, the children of Israel had not done so in this manner since the days of Joshua the son of Nun, until that very day. And there was exceedingly great rejoicing.

verses.latin: Legit autem Esdras in libro legis Dei per dies singulos, a die primo usque ad diem novissimum. Et fecerunt solemnitatem septem diebus: et in die octavo collecta juxta ritum.
verses.english: Ezra also read from the Book of the Law of God each and every day, from the first day of the feast until the last. They celebrated the solemnity for seven days, and on the eighth day, there was a solemn assembly according to the prescribed ritual of the Law.

verses.latin: Attulit ergo Esdras sacerdos legem coram multitudine virorum et mulierum et omnium qui poterant intelligere, in die prima mensis septimi.
verses.english: So Ezra, the priest, brought the book of the Law before the great multitude of men and women and all those who could listen and understand. This happened on the first day of the seventh month.

verses.latin: Et legit in eo in platea quae est ante portam aquarum, a mane usque ad meridiem, in conspectu virorum et mulierum, et eorum qui intelligere poterant: et auribus omnium populorum sonabat liber.
verses.english: And he read from it in the public square that was in front of the Water Gate, from the early morning until midday. He read in the presence of the men and women, and those who were able to understand, and the words of the book resonated in the ears of all the people, as they listened intently.

verses.latin: Stetit autem Esdras scriba super gradum ligneum, quem fecerat ad loquendum: et steterunt juxta eum Mathathias, et Sama, et Ania, et Uria, et Helcia, et Maasia, ad dexteram ejus: et ad sinistram Phadaia, Misaël, et Melchia, et Hasum, et Hasbadana, Zacharia, et Mosollam.
verses.english: Now Ezra, the scribe, stood on a wooden platform which he had made for speaking. And beside him stood Mattithiah, Shema, Anaiah, Uriah, Hilkiah, and Maaseiah, to his right. And to his left were Pedaiah, Mishael, Malchijah, Hashum, Hashbaddana, Zechariah, and Meshullam.

verses.latin: Et aperuit Esdras librum coram omni populo: nam super universum populum eminens, et cum aperuisset eum, stetit omnis populus.
verses.english: And Ezra opened the book before all the people, for he stood high above all of them. And when he opened it, all the people stood up in reverence.

verses.latin: Et benedixit Esdras Domino Deo magno: et respondit omnis populus, Amen, Amen, elevans manus suas: et incurvati sunt, et adoraverunt Deum proni in terram.
verses.english: And Ezra blessed the Lord, the great God. And all the people answered, "Amen! Amen!" raising their hands in agreement. Then they bowed down and worshiped God with their faces to the ground.

verses.latin: Porro Josue, et Bani, et Serebia, Jamin, Accub, Septhai, Odia, Maasia, Celita, Azarias, Jozabed, Hanan, Faleia Levitæ tacere faciebant populum ut audiret legem: et omnis populus stabat in gradu suo.
verses.english: Furthermore, Jeshua, Bani, Sherebiah, Jamin, Akkub, Shabbethai, Hodiah, Maaseiah, Kelita, Azariah, Jozabad, Hanan, and Pelaiah, who were Levites, made the people remain silent so they would listen to the Law. And all the people remained standing in their place.

verses.latin: Et legerunt in libro legis Dei distincte et aperte ad intelligendum: et intellexerunt cum legeretur.
verses.english: And they read from the book of the Law of God, explaining it distinctly and clearly so that it could be understood. And the people understood the Law as it was being read to them.

verses.latin: Dixerunt autem Nehemias ipse et Esdras sacerdos et scriba, et Levitæ interpretantes universo populo: Dies sanctificatus est Domino Deo nostro, nolite lugere, et nolite flere. Flebat enim omnis populus cum audiret verba legis.
verses.english: Then Nehemiah himself, and Ezra the priest and scribe, and the Levites who were instructing all the people, said to them, "This day is consecrated to the Lord our God. Do not mourn and do not weep, for all the people were weeping when they heard the words of the Law."

verses.latin: Et dixit eis: Ite, comedite pinguia, et bibite mulsum, et mittite partes his qui non præparaverunt sibi: quia sanctus est dies Domini nostri: et nolite contristari: gaudium enim Domini est fortitudo nostra.
verses.english: And he said to them, "Go now, eat rich food and drink sweet wine, and send portions to those who have not prepared anything for themselves. For this day is holy to our Lord; do not be grieved, for the joy of the Lord is our strength."

verses.latin: Et Levitæ componebant omne populum, dicentes: Tacete, quia dies sanctus est, et nolite contristari.
verses.english: And the Levites calmed all the people, saying, "Be silent, for this day is holy, and do not be grieved."

verses.latin: Et abiit omnis populus ut comederet, et biberet, et mitteret partes, et faceret lætitiam magnam: quia intellexerant verba quæ docuerat eos.
verses.english: So all the people went away to eat and drink, and to send portions, and to make great rejoicing. For they had understood the words that had been taught to them, and they were filled with joy.

verses.latin: Et in die secundo convenerunt principes familiarum universi populi, sacerdotes, et Levitæ ad Esdram scribam, ut interpretaretur eis super sermones legis.
verses.english: And on the second day, the heads of the families of all the people, along with the priests and the Levites, gathered to Ezra the scribe, so that he might interpret for them more about the words of the Law.

verses.latin: Et invenerunt scriptum in lege, quod præcepisset Dominus in manu Moysi filiis Israël, ut habitarent in tabernaculis in die solemni mensis septimi:
verses.english: And they found written in the Law, that the Lord had commanded through Moses for the children of Israel to dwell in booths during the solemn feast of the seventh month.

verses.latin: et ut prædicarent, et divulgarent vocem in universis civitatibus suis, et in Jerusalem, dicentes: Egredimini in montem, et afferte frondes olivæ, et frondes ligni pulcherrimi, frondes myrti, et ramos palmæ, et frondes ligni frondosi, ut fiant tabernacula, sicut scriptum est.
verses.english: And that they should proclaim and spread the word throughout all their cities and in Jerusalem, saying, "Go out to the mountain, and bring branches of olive, and branches of beautiful trees, branches of myrtle, and palm branches, and branches of leafy trees, so that booths may be made, as it is written."

verses.latin: Et egressus est populus, et attulerunt. Et fecerunt sibi tabernacula unusquisque in domate suo, et in atriis suis, et in atriis domus Dei, et in platea portæ aquarum, et in platea portæ Ephraim.
verses.english: And the people went out and brought them. And they made booths for themselves, each one on his own housetop, and in their courtyards, and in the courtyards of the house of God, and in the public square of the Water Gate, and in the public square of the Gate of Ephraim.

verses.latin: Fecit ergo universa ecclesia eorum qui redierant de captivitate, tabernacula: et habitaverunt in tabernaculis. Non enim fecerant a diebus Josue filii Nun taliter filii Israël usque ad diem illam: et fuit lætitia magna.
verses.english: So the entire assembly of those who had returned from captivity made booths, and they dwelt in them. For the children of Israel had not done so from the days of Joshua the son of Nun until that very day. And there was great rejoicing.

verses.latin: Et legit in volumine legis Dei per dies singulos a die prima usque ad diem novissimam. Et fecerunt diem festum septem diebus: et in die octava collecta juxta ritum.
verses.english: And Ezra read from the volume of the Law of God each and every day, from the first day until the very last day of the feast. And they kept the feast for seven days, and on the eighth day there was a solemn assembly, according to the prescribed custom.

verses.latin: In die autem vigesima quarta mensis hujus, convenerunt filii Israel in jejunio et in sacco et cinere super eos.
verses.english: Now on the twenty-fourth day of this month, the sons of Israel gathered together, in a state of fasting, dressed in sackcloth, and with ashes sprinkled upon them.

verses.latin: Et separatum est semen Israel ab omni alienigena: et steterunt, et confitebantur peccata sua, et iniquitates patrum suorum.
verses.english: And the people of Israel separated themselves from all foreign influence and people. They then stood publicly to confess their sins, acknowledging also the grave sins of their ancestors.

verses.latin: Et surrexerunt, qui erant de tribu Levi, Jesua, et Bani, Cedmihel, Sebania, Bonni, Serebia, Bonni, Chanani: et legerunt in libro Legis Domini Dei sui quarta parte diei, et quarta parte diei confitebantur, et adorabant Dominum Deum suum.
verses.english: Then the Levites—Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bunni, and Chenani—stood and read aloud from the Book of the Law of their Lord God for a full quarter of the day. For another full quarter of the day, they engaged in solemn confession and fervent worship of their Lord God.

verses.latin: Steterunt autem super gradum Levitarum, Jesua, et Bani, Cedmihel, Sabania, Bonni, Serebia, Chanani, et precati sunt voce magna ad Dominum Deum suum.
verses.english: Jeshua, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, and Chenani stood on the platform designated for the Levites and cried out with a loud voice to the Lord their God in prayer.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt Levitae, Jesua, et Cedmihel, Bonni, Hasebnia, Serebia, Odaia, Sebnia, Fathahia: Surgite, benedicite Dominum Deum vestrum ab aeterno usque in aeternum: et benedicant nomini gloriae tuae excelso in omni benedictione et laude.
verses.english: And the Levites—Jeshua, Kadmiel, Bunni, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah—exhorted the people, saying, 'Stand up and bless the Lord your God, from everlasting to everlasting! May they bless Your glorious Name, which is exalted above all blessing and praise!'

verses.latin: Tu ipse, Domine, solus, tu fecisti caelum, et caelum caelorum, et omnem exercitum eorum, terram, et universa quae in ea sunt: maria, et omnia quae in eis sunt: et tu vivificas omnia, et exercitus caelorum te adorat.
verses.english: You alone, O Lord, are God. You created the universe and the highest heavens, and all the celestial beings within them. You made the earth and everything upon it, the seas and everything within them. You give life to all of them, and all the celestial beings worship You.

verses.latin: Tu ipse es, Domine Deus, qui elegisti Abram, et eduxisti eum de igne Chaldaeorum, et posuisti nomen ejus Abraham.
verses.english: You alone are the Lord God, Who chose Abram and brought him forth from Ur of the Chaldees, and changed his name to Abraham.

verses.latin: Et invenisti cor ejus fidele coram te: et percussisti cum eo foedus, ut dares terram Chananaei, Hethaei, Amorrhaei, et Pherezaei, et Jebusaei, et Gergesaei, et daret semini ejus: et implevisti verba tua, quoniam justus es.
verses.english: You found his heart faithful before You, and You made a covenant with him to give the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, and the Girgashites to his descendants. And You fulfilled Your promises, because You are just.

verses.latin: Et vidisti afflictionem patrum nostrorum in Aegypto, et clamorem eorum audisti juxta mare Rubrum.
verses.english: You saw the suffering of our ancestors in Egypt, and You heard their cry for help by the Red Sea.

verses.latin: Et dedisti signa atque portenta in Pharaone, et in omnibus servis ejus, et in universa terrae illius: sciebas enim quia superbe egerant contra eos: et fecisti tibi nomen sicut et in hac die.
verses.english: And You performed great signs and wonders against Pharaoh, and against all his servants, and against all the people of that land, because You knew they had acted with arrogant cruelty against our people. Thus, You established Your Name as it is known even to this day.

verses.latin: Et mare divisisti ante eos, et transierunt per medium maris in sicco: ipsos vero persequentes projecisti in profundum, quasi lapidem in aquis vehementibus.
verses.english: You divided the sea before them, and they passed through the midst of the sea on dry ground. But their pursuers You cast into the depths, like a stone plunged into raging waters.

verses.latin: Et in columna nubis dux eras eorum per diem, et in columna ignis per noctem, ut ostenderes eis viam per quam ingrederentur.
verses.english: You were their guide by day in a pillar of cloud, and by night in a pillar of fire, to show them the way they should go.

verses.latin: Ad montem quoque Sinai descendisti, et locutus es cum eis de caelo, et dedisti eis judicia recta, et legem veritatis, caeremonias, et praecepta bona.
verses.english: You also descended upon Mount Sinai and spoke with them from the sky. You gave them righteous judgments and a true law, along with good ceremonies and commandments.

verses.latin: Et sabbatum sanctificatum tuum ostendisti eis: et mandata, et caeremonias, et legem praecepisti eis in manu Moysi servi tui.
verses.english: You made Your holy Sabbath known to them, and through Your servant Moses, You commanded them to obey Your precepts, Your ceremonies, and Your Law.

verses.latin: Et panem de caelo dedisti eis in fame eorum, et aquam de petra eduxisti eis sitientibus: et dixisti eis ut ingrederentur, et possiderent terram super quam levasti manum tuam ut dareis eis.
verses.english: You gave them bread from the sky in their hunger, and brought forth water from the rock for them when they were thirsty. You commanded them to go in and take possession of the land concerning which You had sworn an oath to give it to them.

verses.latin: Ipsi vero et patres nostri superbe egerunt, et induraverunt cervices suas, et non audierunt mandata tua.
verses.english: However, they—our ancestors—acted arrogantly and stubbornly resisted Your commands, refusing to listen to Your precepts.

verses.latin: Et noluerunt obedire, et non sunt memores mirabilium tuorum quae fecerant eis. Et induraverunt cervicem suam, et posuerunt caput ut reverterentur ad servitutem suam quasi per contentionem. Tu autem Deus propitius, clemens et misericors, longanimis, et multae miserationis, et non dereliquisti eos.
verses.english: They refused to obey and did not remember the marvelous works You had done for them. They hardened their necks and appointed a leader to return to their bondage in Egypt, as if in defiance of You. But You are a God of pardon, gracious and merciful, patient, and full of great compassion, and You did not abandon them.

verses.latin: Sed et cum fecissent sibi vitulum conflatilem, et dixissent: Iste est Deus tuus, qui eduxit te de Aegypto: feceruntque blasphemias magnas.
verses.english: Even when they made for themselves a molten calf and said, 'This is your god who brought you up out of Egypt!'—they committed great blasphemies.

verses.latin: Tu autem in misericordiis tuis multis non dimisisti eos in deserto: columna nubis non recessit ab eis per diem, ut duceret eos in via: et columna ignis per noctem, ut ostenderet eis iter per quod ingrederentur.
verses.english: Yet, in Your great mercies, You did not abandon them in the desert. The pillar of cloud did not depart from them by day to lead them on the way, nor the pillar of fire by night to show them the path they should take.

verses.latin: Et spiritum tuum bonum dedisti, qui doceret eos: et manna tuum non prohibuisti ab ore eorum: et aquam dedisti eis in siti.
verses.english: You also gave Your good Spirit to instruct them. You did not withhold Your manna from their mouths, and You gave them water when they were thirsty.

verses.latin: Quadraginta annis pavisti eos in deserto, et nihil eis defuit: vestimenta eorum non inveteraverunt, et pedes eorum non sunt attriti.
verses.english: For forty years You nourished them in the desert, and they lacked nothing. Their clothes did not wear out, and their feet did not swell or become sore.

verses.latin: Et dedisti eis regna et populos, et partitus es eis sorte: et possederunt terram Sehon, et terram regis Hesebon, et terram Og regis Basan.
verses.english: You gave them kingdoms and peoples, and You allotted territories to them. They took possession of the land of Sihon, the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og, the king of Bashan.

verses.latin: Et multiplicasti filios eorum sicut stellas caeli, et adduxisti eos ad terram de qua dixeras patribus eorum ut ingrederentur et possiderent.
verses.english: You multiplied their children like the stars of the sky, and brought them into the land about which You had told their ancestors they should enter and possess.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt filii, et possederunt terram: et humiliasti coram eis habitatores terrae Chananaeos, et dedisti eos in manus eorum, et reges eorum, et populos terrae, ut facerent eis sicut placeret illis.
verses.english: So the children came and possessed the land. You humbled before them the Canaanite inhabitants of the land, and You delivered them—their kings and the peoples of the land—into their hands, so that they could do with them as they pleased.

verses.latin: Ceperuntque urbes munitas, et humum pinguem: et possederunt domos plenas cunctis bonis: cisternas excisas, et vineas, et oliveta, et ligna pomifera multa: et comederunt, et saturati sunt, et impinguati sunt, et abundavere deliciis tuis magnis.
verses.english: They captured fortified cities and fertile land. They took possession of houses filled with all kinds of good things: wells already dug, vineyards, olive groves, and many fruit trees. They ate, were satisfied, grew fat, and reveled in Your great abundance.

verses.latin: Navi vero, et ad iracundiam te provocaverunt, et projecerunt legem tuam post tergum suum: et prophetas tuos occiderunt, qui testabantur adversus eos, ut reverterentur ad te: feceruntque blasphemias magnas.
verses.english: But they became disobedient and provoked Your anger. They cast Your Law behind their backs and murdered Your prophets who testified against them to bring them back to You. They committed great blasphemies.

verses.latin: Et dedisti eos in manus hostium suorum, et afflixerunt eos. Et in tempore tribulationis suae clamaverunt ad te, et tu de caelo audisti: et secundum miserationes tuas multas dedisti eis salvatores, qui salvarent eos de manu hostium suorum.
verses.english: Therefore, You delivered them into the hands of their enemies, who afflicted them. But in the time of their distress, they cried out to You, and You heard them from the sky. According to Your many mercies, You gave them saviors who rescued them from the hand of their enemies.

verses.latin: Cumque requievissent, revertebantur ut facerent malum coram te: et dimisisti eos in manu inimicorum suorum, et subjecti sunt eis. Et conversi sunt, et clamaverunt ad te: tu autem de caelo audisti, et liberasti eos per multas vices in misericordiis tuis.
verses.english: But as soon as they had rest, they returned to doing evil in Your sight. So You abandoned them to the hand of their enemies, and they were subjected to them. Yet, when they turned back and cried out to You, You heard from the sky and, in Your mercies, delivered them many times.

verses.latin: Et testificatus es eis ut reverterentur ad legem tuam: ipsi vero superbe egerunt, et non audierunt mandata tua, et in judiciis tuis peccaverunt, quae faciet homo et vivet in eis: et dederunt humerum rebellem, et cervicem suam induraverunt, nec audierunt.
verses.english: You testified against them, urging them to return to Your Law. But they acted arrogantly and would not listen to Your commandments. They sinned against Your ordinances, which a person must obey to live by them. They defiantly turned their backs and stiffened their necks, refusing to listen.

verses.latin: Et protraxisti super eos annos multos: et testificatus es in eis in spiritu tuo per manus prophetarum tuorum: et non audierunt, et tradidisti eos in manu populorum terrarum.
verses.english: You bore with them for many years and testified against them by Your Spirit through the hands of Your prophets. Yet, they would not listen, so You delivered them into the hands of the peoples of the lands.

verses.latin: In misericordiis autem tuis plurimis non consumpsisti eos, neque dereliquisti eos: quoniam Deus propitius et misericors es tu.
verses.english: Nevertheless, in Your abundant mercies, You did not utterly destroy them nor abandon them, for You are a gracious and merciful God.

verses.latin: Nunc itaque Deus noster magne, fortis et terribilis, custodiens pactum et misericordiam, ne avertas a facie tua omnem laborem, qui apprehendit nos, reges nostros, et principes nostros, et sacerdotes nostros, et prophetas nostros, et patres nostros, et omnem populum tuum, a diebus regis Assyriorum usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: Now therefore, our God, great, mighty, and terrible, Who keeps covenant and mercy, do not let all the trouble that has come upon us seem insignificant in Your sight. This trouble has afflicted our kings, our princes, our priests, our prophets, our ancestors, and all Your people, from the days of the kings of Assyria until this very day.

verses.latin: Et tu justus es in omnibus quae venerunt super nos: quia veritatem fecisti, nos autem impie egimus.
verses.english: You are just in all that has come upon us, for You have acted faithfully, but we have acted wickedly.

verses.latin: Reges nostri, principes nostri, sacerdotes nostri, et patres nostri non fecerunt legem tuam, nec attendertunt mandata tua, et testimonia tua quibus testificatus es in eis.
verses.english: Our kings, our princes, our priests, and our ancestors did not follow Your Law. They did not pay attention to Your commandments or to Your testimonies by which You warned them.

verses.latin: Ipsi enim in regnis suis, et in bonitate tua multa, quam dederas eis, et in terra latissima et pingui quam tradideras in conspectu eorum, non servierunt tibi, nec reversi sunt a studiis suis pessimis.
verses.english: For even in their kingdoms, and despite Your great goodness that You had given them, and in the very spacious and fertile land that You had delivered before them, they did not serve You. Nor did they turn from their wicked practices.

verses.latin: Ecce nos ipsi hodie servi sumus: et in terra quam dedisti patribus nostris, ut comederent fructum ejus, et bona ejus, nos ipsi servi sumus.
verses.english: Behold, we ourselves are servants today. And in the very land You gave to our ancestors, for them to eat its fruit and enjoy its good things, we ourselves are servants.

verses.latin: Et fruges ejus multiplicantur regibus, quos posuisti super nos propter peccata nostra: et corporibus nostris dominantur, et jumentis nostris secundum voluntatem suam: et in tribulatione magna sumus.
verses.english: Its abundant produce now goes to the kings You have placed over us because of our sins. They dominate our bodies and our livestock according to their own will, and we are in great distress.

verses.latin: Propter omnia igitur haec nos ipsi percutimus foedus, et scribimus: et signant principes nostri, Levitae nostri, et sacerdotes nostri.
verses.english: Because of all this, we ourselves are making a firm covenant and writing it down. Our princes, our Levites, and our priests are putting their seals upon it.

verses.latin: Die autem vicesimo quarto mensis hujus, convenerunt filii Israel in jejunio, et in saccis, et cinere super capita eorum.
verses.english: On the twenty-fourth day of this particular month, the children of Israel gathered together. They were engaged in fasting, dressed in sackcloth, and had ashes on their heads as a sign of repentance.

verses.latin: Et separaverunt se filii Israel ab omni filio alienigenæ: et steterunt, et confessi sunt peccata sua, et iniquitates patrum suorum.
verses.english: And the children of Israel separated themselves from all foreign people. They stood up and publicly confessed their own sins and the wickedness that their ancestors had committed.

verses.latin: Et surrexerunt ad standum: et legerunt in volumine Legis Domini Dei sui quatuor partes diei: et quatuor partes confitebantur, et adorabant Dominum Deum suum.
verses.english: Then they stood up, and for one quarter of the day they read from the book of the Law of the Lord their God. For another quarter of the day, they confessed their sins and worshipped the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Surrexit autem super gradum Levitarum Josue, et Bani, et Cedmihel, Sebania, Bonni, Serebia, Bani, Chanani: et clamaverunt voce magna ad Dominum Deum suum.
verses.english: Then Josue, Bani, Kadmiel, Shebaniah, Bunni, Sherebiah, Bani, and Chenani stood on the platform designated for the Levites. They then cried out with a loud voice to the Lord their God.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt Levitæ Josue, et Cedmihel, Bani, Hasabnia, Serebia, Odaia, Sebania, Phathahia: Surgite, benedicite Dominum Deum vestrum ab æterno usque in æternum: et benedicant nomini gloriæ tuæ excelso super omnem benedictionem et laudem.
verses.english: And the Levites—Josue, Kadmiel, Bani, Hashabneiah, Sherebiah, Hodiah, Shebaniah, and Pethahiah—said: “Rise up and bless the Lord your God from everlasting to everlasting. May they bless Your glorious Name, which is exalted above every blessing and praise!

verses.latin: Tu ipse es Dominus solus, tu fecisti cælum, et cælum cælorum, et omnem exercitum eorum, terram, et universa quæ in ea sunt: maria, et omnia quæ in eis sunt: et tu vivificas omnia, et exercitus cæli te adorat.
verses.english: You alone are the Lord. You created the universe and all the heavens within it, with all their hosts of stars and celestial bodies. You created the earth and everything that is in it: the seas and all that is in them. You give life to all of them, and the heavenly hosts worship You.

verses.latin: Tu ipse, Domine Deus, qui elegisti Abram, et eduxisti eum de igne Chaldæorum, et posuisti nomen ejus Abraham.
verses.english: You, O Lord God, are the One who chose Abram. You brought him out from the Ur of the Chaldeans, which was a place of idolatry and evil. You then changed his name to Abraham.

verses.latin: Et invenisti cor ejus fidele coram te: et percussisti cum eo fœdus, ut dares ei terram Chananæi, Hethæi, Amorrhæi, Pherezæi, Jebusæi, et Gergesæi, et semini ejus: et implevisti verba tua, quoniam justus es.
verses.english: You found his heart to be faithful before You, and You made a covenant with him. You promised to give him the land of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Amorites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, and the Girgashites, and to his descendants. You kept Your promises because You are just.

verses.latin: Et vidisti afflictionem patrum nostrorum in Ægypto, et clamorem eorum audisti juxta mare Rubrum.
verses.english: You saw the affliction of our ancestors in Egypt. You heard their cry for help by the Red Sea.

verses.latin: Et dedisti signa atque portenta in Pharaone, et in universis servis ejus, et in omni terra ejus: sciebas enim quia superbe agebant contra eos: et fecisti tibi nomen sicut et in hac die.
verses.english: You performed signs and wonders against Pharaoh, against all his servants, and against all his land. For You knew that they had dealt proudly and oppressively against our ancestors. You made a name for Yourself that is still revered to this very day.

verses.latin: Et mare divisisti ante eos, et transierunt per medium maris in sicco: ipsos vero persequentes projecisti in profundum, quasi lapidem in aquis vehementibus.
verses.english: You divided the sea before them, and they passed through the middle of the sea on dry ground. But their pursuers You cast into the deep, like a stone thrown into mighty waters.

verses.latin: Et in columna nubis ductor eorum fuisti per diem, et in columna ignis per noctem, ut ostenderes eis viam per quam ingrederentur.
verses.english: You led them by a pillar of cloud during the day and by a pillar of fire at night, so that You might show them the way they should go.

verses.latin: Ad montem quoque Sina descendisti, et locutus es cum eis de cælo, et dedisti eis judicia recta, et legem veritatis, cæremonias et præcepta bona.
verses.english: You also descended upon Mount Sinai and spoke with them from the heavens. You gave them righteous judgments and the Law of truth, good statutes, and commandments.

verses.latin: Et sabbatum sanctificatum tuum ostendisti eis: et mandata, et cæremonias, et legem, præcepisti eis in manu Moysi servi tui.
verses.english: You made known to them Your holy Sabbath, and You commanded them precepts, statutes, and the Law through the hand of Moses, Your servant.

verses.latin: Et panem de cælo dedisti eis in fame eorum, et aquam de petra eduxisti eis sitientibus: et dixisti eis ut ingrederentur, et possiderent terram super quam levasti manum tuam ut dareis eis.
verses.english: You gave them bread from the sky during their hunger, and You brought forth water for them from the rock when they were thirsty. And You told them to go in and possess the land, which You had sworn to give them by raising Your hand.

verses.latin: Ipsi vero et patres nostri superbe egerunt, et induraverunt cervices suas, et non audierunt mandata tua.
verses.english: But they, our ancestors, acted proudly. They stiffened their necks in rebellion and refused to listen to Your commandments.

verses.latin: Et noluerunt obedire, et non sunt recordati mirabilium tuorum quæ feceratis eis: et induraverunt cervices suas, et posuerunt caput ut reverterentur ad servitutem suam quasi per contentionem. Tu autem Deus propitius, clemens et misericors, longanimis et multæ miserationis, non dereliquisti eos.
verses.english: They refused to obey and did not remember the wonderful things You had done for them. They stiffened their necks and appointed a leader to return to their slavery in Egypt, as if through contention. But You, O God, are forgiving, gracious, and merciful. You are patient and abounding in compassion. You did not abandon them.

verses.latin: Quin potius et vitulum fusile fecerunt sibi, et dixerunt: Iste est Deus tuus, qui eduxit te de Ægypto: et fecerunt blasphemias magnas.
verses.english: Indeed, they even made a molten calf for themselves and said, 'This is your god who brought you out of Egypt!' And they committed great blasphemies.

verses.latin: Tu autem in multitudine miserationum tuarum non dimisisti eos in deserto: columna nubis non recessit ab eis per diem, ut duceret eos in via: et columna ignis per noctem, ut ostenderet eis iter per quod ingrederentur.
verses.english: Yet, in Your abundant mercies, You did not abandon them in the desert. The pillar of cloud did not depart from them by day, guiding them on their way, nor did the pillar of fire by night, showing them the path they should take.

verses.latin: Et spiritum tuum bonum dedisti, qui doceret eos, et manna tuum non prohibuisti ab ore eorum, et aquam dedisti eis in siti.
verses.english: You also gave Your good Spirit to instruct them. You did not withhold Your manna from their mouths, and You gave them water when they were thirsty.

verses.latin: Quadraginta annis nutristi eos in deserto, nihil eis defuit: vestimenta eorum non sunt attrita, et pedes eorum non sunt arentes.
verses.english: For forty years You nourished them in the desert, and they lacked nothing. Their clothes did not wear out, and their feet did not swell.

verses.latin: Et dedisti eis regna et populos, et partitus es eis sortes: et possederunt terram Sehon, et terram regis Hesebon, et terram Og regis Basan.
verses.english: You gave them kingdoms and peoples, and You allotted them territories. So they possessed the land of Sihon, the land of the king of Heshbon, and the land of Og, the king of Bashan.

verses.latin: Et filios eorum multiplicasti sicut stellas cæli, et adduxisti eos ad terram de qua dixeras patribus eorum ut ingrederentur et possiderent.
verses.english: You multiplied their children like the stars of the sky. You brought them to the land of which You had told their ancestors, so that they might go in and possess it.

verses.latin: Et venerunt filii, et possederunt terram: et humiliasti coram eis habitatores terræ Chananæos, et dedisti eos in manu eorum, et reges eorum, et populos terræ, ut facerent eis sicut placeret illis.
verses.english: And the children came and possessed the land. You humbled before them the Canaanite inhabitants of the land. You delivered the Canaanites into their hand, along with their kings and the peoples of the land, so that our ancestors might do with them as they pleased.

verses.latin: Ceperuntque urbes munitas, et humum fertilem, et possederunt domos plenas cunctis bonis, cisternas dolatas, vineas et oliveta, et ligna pomifera multa: et comederunt, et saturati sunt, et impinguati sunt, et abundavere deliciis tuis magnis.
verses.english: They captured fortified cities and fertile ground. They took possession of houses full of all good things, hewn cisterns, vineyards, and olive groves, and many fruit trees. They ate and were satisfied. They grew fat and abounded in Your great delicacies.

verses.latin: Et provocaverunt te in iracundiam, et recesserunt a te, et projecerunt legem tuam post terga sua: et prophetas tuos occiderunt, qui contestabantur eos ut reverterentur ad te: feceruntque blasphemias magnas.
verses.english: Yet they provoked You to anger and turned away from You. They cast Your Law behind their backs and killed Your prophets who testified against them to bring them back to You. They committed great blasphemies.

verses.latin: Et dedisti eos in manu hostium suorum, et afflixerunt eos. Et in tempore tribulationis suæ clamaverunt ad te, et tu de cælo audisti, et secundum miserationes tuas multas dedisti eis salvatores, qui salvaverunt eos de manu hostium suorum.
verses.english: So You delivered them into the hand of their enemies, and their enemies afflicted them. But in the time of their tribulation, they cried out to You, and You heard them from the heavens. According to Your great mercies, You gave them saviors who saved them from the hand of their enemies.

verses.latin: Cumque requievissent, revertebantur ut facerent malum in conspectu tuo: et dimisisti eos in manu inimicorum suorum, et subjecerunt eos. Et conversi sunt, et clamaverunt ad te: et tu de cælo audisti, et liberasti eos per multas vices in miserationibus tuis.
verses.english: But when they had rest, they returned to doing evil in Your sight. So You left them in the hand of their enemies, who subjugated them. Then they turned back and cried out to You, and You heard them from the heavens. You delivered them many times through Your mercies.

verses.latin: Et contestabaris eos ut reduceres eos ad legem tuam. Ipsi vero superbe egerunt, et non audierunt mandata tua, et in judiciis tuis peccaverunt, quæ faciet homo, et vivet in eis: et dederunt humerum recedentem, et cervicem suam induraverunt, nec audierunt.
verses.english: You earnestly warned them to bring them back to Your Law. But they acted proudly and did not listen to Your commandments. They sinned against Your judgments—those judgments by which a person lives when he keeps them. They turned a rebellious shoulder, stiffened their necks, and refused to listen.

verses.latin: Et protraxisti super eos annos multos: et contestatus es eos in spiritu tuo per manum prophetarum tuorum: et non audierunt, et tradidisti eos in manu populorum terrarum.
verses.english: You bore with them for many years. You solemnly warned them by Your Spirit through the hand of Your prophets. Yet they did not listen, so You delivered them into the hands of the peoples of the lands around them.

verses.latin: In misericordiis autem tuis plurimis non consumpsisti eos, neque dereliquisti eos: quoniam Deus propitius et misericors es tu.
verses.english: Nevertheless, in Your abundant mercies, You did not utterly consume them nor did You abandon them, because You are a forgiving and merciful God.

verses.latin: Nunc itaque Deus noster magne, fortis et terribilis, custos pacti et misericordiæ, ne avertas a facie tua omnem laborem qui apprehendit nos, reges nostros, principes nostros, et sacerdotes nostros, et prophetas nostros, et patres nostros, et omnem populum tuum a diebus regis Assur usque in diem hanc.
verses.english: Now therefore, our God, great, mighty, and awesome, You who keep covenant and mercy, do not let all the hardship that has come upon us seem insignificant in Your sight. It has come upon our kings, our princes, our priests, our prophets, our ancestors, and all Your people, from the days of the kings of Assyria until this very day.

verses.latin: Et tu justus es in omnibus quæ venerunt super nos: quia veritatem fecisti, nos vero impie egimus.
verses.english: You are just in all that has come upon us, for You have acted faithfully, but we have acted wickedly.

verses.latin: Reges nostri, principes nostri, sacerdotes nostri, et patres nostri non fecerunt legem tuam, nec attenderunt ad præcepta tua, et ad testimonia tua quæ testificatus es in eis.
verses.english: Our kings, our princes, our priests, and our ancestors did not follow Your Law. They paid no attention to Your commandments or to Your warnings that You gave them.

verses.latin: Et ipsi in regnis suis, et in bonitate tua multa quam dederas eis, et in terra latissima et pingui quam tradideras in conspectu eorum, non servierunt tibi, nec reversi sunt a studiis suis pessimis.
verses.english: Even in their own kingdoms, and despite Your abundant goodness that You gave them, and in the very broad and rich land which You delivered before them, they did not serve You. They did not turn from their wicked practices.

verses.latin: Ecce nos ipsi hodie servi sumus: et in terra quam dedisti patribus nostris ut comederent fructum ejus, et bona illius, et nos ipsi servi sumus in ea.
verses.english: Behold, we ourselves are servants today. In the land that You gave to our ancestors to enjoy its fruit and its good things, we ourselves are now servants within it.

verses.latin: Et fruges ejus multiplicantur regibus quos posuisti super nos propter peccata nostra: et corporibus nostris dominantur, et jumentis nostris, secundum voluntatem suam: et in tribulatione magna sumus.
verses.english: Its abundant produce now goes to the kings whom You have set over us because of our sins. They rule over our bodies and our livestock according to their own will, and we are in great tribulation.

verses.latin: Super omnibus igitur his nos ipsi percutimus fœdus, et scribimus, et signant principes nostri, Levitæ nostri, et sacerdotes nostri.
verses.english: Therefore, concerning all these things, we ourselves are making a solemn covenant and writing it down. Our princes, our Levites, and our priests are putting their seals upon it.

verses.latin: Signabant autem Nehemias Athersatha, filius Hachaliam, et Sedecias,
verses.english: Those who signed were Nehemiah the governor, son of Hacaliah, and Zedekiah.

verses.latin: Saraia, Azarias, Jeremias, Pheshur, Amaria, Melchia, Hattus, Sebania, Melluch, Harim, Bana, Meremoth, Abdia, Daniel, Genthon, Baruch, Mosollam, Abia, Miamin, Maazia, Belgia, Semeia: hi sacerdotes.
verses.english: Also Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah, Pashhur, Amariah, Malchijah, Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch, Harim, Baanah, Meremoth, Obadiah, Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch, Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin, Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah. These were the priests who signed the covenant.

verses.latin: Hi autem qui signaverunt, fuerunt Nehemias, Athersatha filius Hachaliam, et Sedecias,
verses.english: These are the ones who put their seal upon the covenant: Nehemiah, the governor (son of Hacaliah), and Zedekiah,

verses.latin: Saraia, Azarias, Jeremias,
verses.english: Seraiah, Azariah, Jeremiah,

verses.latin: Pashur, Amaria, Melchia,
verses.english: Pashhur, Amariah, Malchijah,

verses.latin: Hattush, Sebanias, Malluch,
verses.english: Hattush, Shebaniah, Malluch,

verses.latin: Harim, Meremoth, Abdia,
verses.english: Harim, Meremoth, Obadiah,

verses.latin: Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch,
verses.english: Daniel, Ginnethon, Baruch,

verses.latin: Mosollam, Abia, Miamin,
verses.english: Meshullam, Abijah, Mijamin,

verses.latin: Maazia, Belgia, Semeia: hi sacerdotes.
verses.english: Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah. These were the priests who signed.

verses.latin: Levitae quoque: Josue filius Azaniae, Bennui de filiis Henadad, Cedmihel,
verses.english: And these were the Levites: Jeshua the son of Azaniah, Binnui from the sons of Henadad, Kadmiel,

verses.latin: Sebania, Odaia, Celita, Falaia, Hanan,
verses.english: Shebaniah, Hodiah, Kelita, Pelaiah, Hanan,

verses.latin: Micha, Roob, Hasebia,
verses.english: Mica, Rehob, Hashabiah,

verses.latin: Zacchur, Serebia, Sabania,
verses.english: Zaccur, Sherebiah, Shebaniah,

verses.latin: Odaia, Bani, Baninu.
verses.english: Hodiah, Bani, Beninu.

verses.latin: Principes populi: Pharos, Phahath Moab, Elam, Zethu, Bani,
verses.english: These were the chiefs of the people: Parosh, Pahath-Moab, Elam, Zattu, Bani,

verses.latin: Buni, Azgad, Bebai,
verses.english: Bunni, Azgad, Bebai,

verses.latin: Adonia, Begnai, Adin,
verses.english: Adonijah, Bigvai, Adin,

verses.latin: Ater, Ezecia, Azur,
verses.english: Ater, Hezekiah, Azzur,

verses.latin: Odaia, Hasum, Besai,
verses.english: Hodiah, Hashum, Bezai,

verses.latin: Hariph, Anathoth, Nebai,
verses.english: Hariph, Anathoth, Nebai,

verses.latin: Megphias, Mosollam, Hesir,
verses.english: Magpiash, Meshullam, Hezir,

verses.latin: Mesezabael, Sadoc, Jeddua,
verses.english: Meshezabel, Zadok, Jaddua,

verses.latin: Phaltia, Hanan, Anaia,
verses.english: Pelatiah, Hanan, Anaiah,

verses.latin: Osee, Hanania, Hassub,
verses.english: Hoshea, Hananiah, Hasshub,

verses.latin: Alohes, Phila, Sobec,
verses.english: Hallohesh, Pilha, Shobek,

verses.latin: Rehum, Hasabna, Maasia,
verses.english: Rehum, Hashabnah, Maaseiah,

verses.latin: et Ahia, Hanan, Anan,
verses.english: Ahiah, Hanan, Anan,

verses.latin: Malluch, Harim, Baana.
verses.english: Malluch, Harim, Baanah.

verses.latin: Et reliqua plebis, sacerdotes, Levitae, janitores, cantores, Nathinaei, et omnis qui se separaverat de populis terrarum ad legem Dei, uxores eorum, filii eorum, et filiae eorum, omnes qui poterant sapere,
verses.english: And the rest of the people—the priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, the singers, the temple servants—and everyone who had separated themselves from the foreign peoples of the land to follow God's law, along with their wives, their sons, and their daughters, all who had understanding—

verses.latin: junxerunt cum fratribus suis potentioribus, et intraverunt sub execratione et in juramento, ut ambularent in lege Dei, quam dederat in manu Moysi servi Dei, et ut facerent et custodirent universa mandata Domini Dei nostri, et judicia ejus, et caeremonias ejus:
verses.english: They joined with their more prominent kinsmen, and solemnly bound themselves by a curse and an oath to walk in God's law, which He had given through His servant Moses. They swore to observe and perform all the commandments of the Lord our God, along with His judgments and His ritual practices.

verses.latin: et ne daremus filias nostras populis terrae, et filias eorum non acciperemus filiis nostris.
verses.english: They also swore that they would not give their daughters in marriage to the foreign peoples of the land, nor would they take the daughters of these peoples as wives for their sons.

verses.latin: Populi quoque terrae, si inferrent venales et omnia cibaria per diem sabbati, et per diem sanctificatum, nihil acciperemus ab eis: et dimitteremus annum septimum, et exactionem omnis manus.
verses.english: They further agreed that if the foreign peoples of the land were to bring goods or any food for sale on the Sabbath or on any other holy day, they would not buy anything from them. They also committed to observing the Sabbath year—the seventh year—by letting the land rest, and they would forgive every debt owed to them.

verses.latin: Et statuimus super nos praecepta, ut daremus tertiam partem sicli per annum ad opus domus Dei nostri,
verses.english: We also imposed ordinances upon ourselves to contribute a third of a shekel each year for the service of the house of our God.

verses.latin: in propositione panum, et in sacrificio sempiterno, et in holocausto sempiterno, et in sabbatis et in calendiis, in his quae sanctificantur, et in primitiis sanctuarii, et pro peccato, et pro universalibus Israëlis, et in omnem usum domus Dei nostri.
verses.english: This contribution was for the showbread, for the regular grain offering, for the regular burnt offering, for the Sabbaths and new moon festivals, for all the consecrated offerings, for the firstfruits of the sanctuary, for the sin offerings to make atonement for all Israel, and for all the necessary services of the house of our God.

verses.latin: Sortes ergo misimus super oblationem lignorum inter sacerdotes, et Levitas, et populum, ut afferrent ligna in domum Dei nostri secundum domos patrum nostrorum, per tempora, anni in diebus statutis, ut adoleatur super altare Domini Dei nostri, sicut scriptum est in lege Moysi.
verses.english: We also cast lots among the priests, the Levites, and the people to determine the schedule for bringing the wood offering to the house of our God. Each ancestral house would bring its portion at appointed times each year on specified days, so that it could be burned upon the altar of the Lord our God, just as it is written in the law of Moses.

verses.latin: Et ut afferremus primitias terrae nostrae, et primitias omnium fructuum ligni, ab anno in annum, in domo Domini.
verses.english: And we agreed to bring the firstfruits of our land and the firstfruits of all the produce from every tree, year after year, to the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et primitiva filiorum nostrorum, et pecudum nostrarum, sicut scriptum est in lege, et primitiva boum nostrorum, et ovium nostrarum, ut afferrentur in domum Dei nostri, sacerdotibus qui ministrant in domo Dei nostri.
verses.english: And we committed to bringing the firstborn of our sons and of our livestock, as it is written in the law, as well as the firstborn of our oxen and our sheep. These offerings are to be brought to the house of our God, to the priests who minister there.

verses.latin: Et primitias ciborum nostrorum, et libamentorum nostrorum, et poma ex omni ligno, vindemiae quoque et olei afferremus sacerdotibus ad cellaria domus Dei nostri, et decimam terrae nostrae Levitis. Ipsi Levitae accipient decimas ex omnibus civitatibus culturae nostrae.
verses.english: We also agreed to bring the firstfruits of our ground grain, our drink offerings, the fruit from every tree, the new wine, and the oil to the priests, to be stored in the storerooms of the house of our God. And we would bring a tenth of our land's produce to the Levites. The Levites themselves are to collect the tithes from all the cities where we farm.

verses.latin: Sacerdos autem filius Aaron erit cum Levitis in decimis Levitarum, et Levitae offerent decimam decimae suae in domo Dei nostri, ad cellaria thesauri.
verses.english: A priest, a son of Aaron, must be present with the Levites when the Levites collect the tithes. And the Levites, in turn, must bring a tenth of their collected tithes to the house of our God, to be placed in the storerooms of the treasury.

verses.latin: Ad cellaria enim afferent filii Israëlis, et filii Levi primitias frumenti, vini, et olei: et ibi erunt vasa sanctuarii, et sacerdotes qui ministrant, et cantores, et janitores: et non dimittemus domum Dei nostri.
verses.english: For to these storerooms, the sons of Israel and the sons of Levi are to bring the firstfruits of their grain, new wine, and oil. There, the vessels of the sanctuary are to be kept, and the priests who minister, along with the singers and the gatekeepers, are to be present. In this way, we declared that we would not neglect the house of our God.

verses.latin: Habitaverunt autem principes populi in Jerusalem: reliqua vero plebs misit sortes ut ducerent unum de decem qui habitaret in Jerusalem civitate sancta, et novem partes in civitatibus.
verses.english: The leaders of the people had already settled in Jerusalem. For the remaining population, lots were cast so that one out of every ten people would come to live in Jerusalem, the holy city, while the other nine out of ten would remain in their respective towns.

verses.latin: Et benedixit populus omnibus viris qui sponte obtulerant se ut habitarent in Jerusalem.
verses.english: The people blessed all those men who willingly volunteered to live in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Hi sunt ergo principes provinciae qui habitaverunt in Jerusalem, et in civitatibus Juda: et unusquisque in possessione sua, in urbibus suis, Israel, sacerdotes, Levitae, Nathinæi, et filii servorum Salomonis.
verses.english: These are the leaders of the province who lived in Jerusalem and in the other cities of Judah, each in his own inherited land and his own town. These included Israelites, priests, Levites, the Nethinim, and the descendants of Solomon's servants.

verses.latin: Et in Jerusalem habitaverunt de filiis Juda, et de filiis Benjamin: de filiis Juda, Athaias filius Azariae, filii Zachariae, filii Amariae, filii Sephatiae, filii Malaleel, de filiis Phares:
verses.english: In Jerusalem, some descendants of Judah and Benjamin took up residence. From the descendants of Judah, there was Athaiah, whose lineage traced back through Azariah, Zechariah, Amariah, Shephatiah, and Mahalalel, all of the family of Perez.

verses.latin: et Maasia filius Baruch, filii Colhozae, filii Hazaiae, filii Adaiae, filii Jojarib, filii Zachariae, filii Siloni.
verses.english: Also from Judah, there was Maaseiah, son of Baruch, whose line went through Col-Hozeh, Hazaiah, Adaiah, Joiarib, and Zechariah, from the family of the Shilonites.

verses.latin: Omnes filii Phares, qui habitaverunt in Jerusalem, quadringenti sexaginta octo viri fortes.
verses.english: All the descendants of Perez who lived in Jerusalem numbered four hundred and sixty-eight strong, capable men.

verses.latin: Et hi filii Benjamin: Sellum filius Mosollam, filii Joed, filii Phadaiae, filii Colaiae, filii Maasiae, filii Ithiel, filii Isaiae:
verses.english: From the descendants of Benjamin, there was Sallu, son of Meshullam, whose ancestry included Joed, Pedaiah, Kolaiah, Maaseiah, Ithiel, and Jeshaiah.

verses.latin: et post eum Gabai, Sellai, nongenti viginti octo.
verses.english: And following him were Gabbai and Sallai, totaling nine hundred and twenty-eight men from Benjamin.

verses.latin: Et Joel filius Zechri praepositus eorum: et Judas filius Senua super civitatem secundus.
verses.english: Joel, son of Zichri, was appointed as their overseer. And Judah, son of Senuah, held the position of second in command over the city.

verses.latin: De sacerdotibus autem: Idaia filius Jojarib, Jachin,
verses.english: Now for the priests: Jedaiah, son of Joiarib, and Jachin.

verses.latin: Saraia filius Helciae, filii Mosollam, filii Sadoc, filii Meraioth, filii Achitob, princeps domus Dei,
verses.english: Seraiah, son of Hilkiah, whose line included Meshullam, Zadok, Meraiah, and Ahitub, served as the chief minister for the house of God, meaning the Temple.

verses.latin: et fratres eorum facientes opera templi: octingenti viginti duo. Et Adaia filius Jeroham, filii Phadiae, filii Amzi, filii Zachariae, filii Pheshur, filii Melchiae,
verses.english: And their brethren, who performed the work in the Temple, numbered eight hundred and twenty-two. There was also Adaiah, son of Jeroham, whose ancestry traced through Pedaiah, Amzi, Zechariah, Pashhur, and Malchijah.

verses.latin: et fratres ejus principes patrum: ducenti quadraginta duo. Et Amasia filius Azareel, filii Ahazi, filii Mosollamoth, filii Emmer,
verses.english: And his brethren, who were the leaders of their ancestral houses, numbered two hundred and forty-two. There was also Amashsai, son of Azarel, whose lineage included Ahzai, Meshillemoth, and Immer.

verses.latin: et fratres eorum fortissimi viri: centum viginti octo. Et praepositus eorum Zabdiel filius potentium.
verses.english: And his brethren, mighty and strong men, numbered one hundred and twenty-eight. Their overseer was Zabdiel, who was a son of the notable men, meaning a prominent family.

verses.latin: De Levitis autem: Semeia filius Hassub, filii Azaricam, filii Hasabiae, filii Buni:
verses.english: Now for the Levites: Shemaiah, son of Hasshub, whose ancestry traced through Azrikam, Hashabiah, and Bunni.

verses.latin: et Sabatai et Jozabed super opera quae erant forinsecus domus Dei, praepositi Levitarum:
verses.english: And Shabbethai and Jozabad were appointed as overseers of the Levites, specifically for the tasks and duties outside the Temple of God.

verses.latin: Et Matthania filius Micha, filii Zebedee, filii Asaph, princeps ad laudandum, et ad confitendum in oratione: et Becbecia secundus de fratribus ejus, et Abda filius Samua, filii Galal, filii Idithun.
verses.english: And Mattaniah, son of Micah, whose line went through Zabdi and Asaph, was the chief leader in offering praise and giving thanks in prayer. Bakbukiah was his second in command among his brethren. There was also Abda, son of Shammua, whose lineage included Galal and Jeduthun.

verses.latin: Omnes Levitae in civitate sancta: ducenti octoginta quatuor.
verses.english: All the Levites who resided in the holy city totaled two hundred and eighty-four.

verses.latin: Et janitores: Accub, Telmon, et fratres eorum, qui custodiebant ostia: centum septuaginta duo.
verses.english: And the gatekeepers: Akkub, Talmon, and their brethren, who were responsible for guarding the gates, numbered one hundred and seventy-two.

verses.latin: Et reliqui de Israel, sacerdotes et Levitae, in universis civitatibus Juda, unusquisque in haereditate sua.
verses.english: The rest of the Israelites, including priests and Levites, remained in all the other cities of Judah, each in his own inherited land.

verses.latin: Nathinæi autem habitaverunt in Ophel: et Sia et Gaspha de Nathinæis.
verses.english: The Nethinim, however, lived in the Ophel district. Ziha and Gishpa were prominent among the Nethinim.

verses.latin: Et praepositus Levitarum in Jerusalem, Azzi filius Bani, filii Hasabiae, filii Matthaniae, filii Micha. De filiis Asaph cantorum in officiis domus Dei.
verses.english: The chief overseer of the Levites in Jerusalem was Uzzi, son of Bani, whose lineage included Hashabiah, Mattaniah, and Micah. He was from the descendants of Asaph, who were the Temple singers responsible for their duties in the House of God.

verses.latin: Quia de rege praeceptum erat de eis, et certum pro cantoribus opus per singulos dies.
verses.english: This arrangement was in place because there was a direct royal decree concerning them, ensuring that the Temple singers received a fixed daily provision for their work.

verses.latin: Et Phathahia filius Mesezebel, de filiis Zara filii Juda, in manu regis juxta omne verbum populi.
verses.english: Pethahiah, son of Meshezabel, a descendant of Zerah from the tribe of Judah, served as the king's personal representative, handling all matters concerning the people.

verses.latin: Et in domibus per vicos eorum: de filiis Juda habitaverunt in Cariatharbe, et in viculis ejus, et in Dibon, et in viculis ejus, et in Cabseel, et in viculis ejus.
verses.english: In the villages and rural areas of their ancestral lands, some descendants of Judah lived in Kiriath-Arba and its surrounding settlements, in Dibon and its surrounding settlements, and in Kabzeel and its surrounding settlements.

verses.latin: Et in Josue, et in Molada, et in Bethphaleth,
verses.english: They also settled in Jeshua, Moladah, and Beth-Pelet.

verses.latin: et in Hasarsual, et in Beersebee, et in viculis ejus,
verses.english: And in Hazar-Shual, and in Beersheba and its surrounding settlements.

verses.latin: et in Siceleg, et in Mochona, et in viculis ejus,
verses.english: And in Ziklag, and in Mekonah and its surrounding settlements.

verses.latin: et in Remmon, et in Saraa, et in Jerimoth,
verses.english: And in Rimmon, and in Zorah, and in Jarmuth.

verses.latin: Zanoa, Adullam, et in viculis earum, Lachis et agris ejus, Azeca et viculis ejus. Et habitaverunt ab Beersebee usque ad vallem Ennom.
verses.english: Zanoah, Adullam, and their surrounding settlements; Lachish and its fields, Azekah and its surrounding settlements. Their settlements extended from Beersheba all the way to the Valley of Hinnom.

verses.latin: Filii autem Benjamin ab Gabaa, Machmas, et Hai, et Bethel, et viculis ejus,
verses.english: The descendants of Benjamin, however, settled in Geba, Michmash, Ai, and Bethel, along with their surrounding settlements.

verses.latin: Anathoth, Nob, Anania,
verses.english: They also settled in Anathoth, Nob, and Anania.

verses.latin: Asor, Rama, Getthaim,
verses.english: And in Hazor, Ramah, and Gittaim.

verses.latin: Hadid, Seboim, et Nehallat,
verses.english: And in Hadid, Zeboim, and Neballat.

verses.latin: Lod, et Ono artificum vallis.
verses.english: And in Lod and Ono, which was known as the Valley of Craftsmen.

verses.latin: Et de Levitis, portiones Judae et Benjamin.
verses.english: And concerning the Levites, some were assigned to the portions of Judah and Benjamin, to serve among them.
