verses.latin: Hi sunt autem sacerdotes et Levitae, qui ascenderunt cum Zorobabel filio Salathiel, et Josue: Saraia, Jeremias, Esdras,
verses.english: These are the priests and Levites who returned to Jerusalem with Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, and with Joshua: Seraiah, Jeremiah, and Ezra.

verses.latin: Amaria, Melluch, Hattus,
verses.english: Also, Amariah, Malluch, and Hattush.

verses.latin: Sechania, Rehum, Merimoth,
verses.english: Shecaniah, Rehum, and Meremoth.

verses.latin: Addo, Genthon, Abia,
verses.english: Iddo, Ginnethoi, and Abijah.

verses.latin: Miamin, Maadia, Helchias,
verses.english: Mijamin, Maadiah, and Bilgah.

verses.latin: Iddia, Sellum, Amoc, Helcias, Adaias,
verses.english: Shemaiah, Joiarib, Jedaiah.

verses.latin: Sellum, Amoc, Helcias, Adaias, Joarib, Idia, Sallum, Amoc, Helcias, Adaias,
verses.english: Sallu, Amok, Hilkiah, and Jedaiah. These were the leaders of the priests and their brethren in the days of Joshua.

verses.latin: Levitae vero Jesua, Bennui, Cedmihel, Sarebia, Juda, Mathanias, super cantores, ipsius et fratres ejus.
verses.english: The Levites were Jeshua, Binnui, Kadmiel, Sherebiah, Judah, and Mattaniah, who, along with his brothers, led the songs of thanksgiving.

verses.latin: Bacbucia, et Hanni, et fratres eorum, unusquisque in officio suo.
verses.english: And Bakbukiah and Unni, their brothers, assisted them, each in his own duty.

verses.latin: Josue autem genuit Joacim, et Joacim genuit Eliasib, et Eliasib genuit Jojada,
verses.english: Joshua was the father of Joiakim. Joiakim was the father of Eliashib. And Eliashib was the father of Joiada.

verses.latin: et Jojada genuit Jonathan, et Jonathan genuit Jeddoa.
verses.english: Joiada was the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan was the father of Jaddua.

verses.latin: In diebus autem Joacim, fuerunt sacerdotes, principes familiarum: Saraiae, Maraia: Jeremiae, Hanania:
verses.english: During the time of Joiakim, these were the heads of the priestly families: for Seraiah, Meraiah; for Jeremiah, Hananiah.

verses.latin: Esdrae, Mosollam: Amariae, Johanan:
verses.english: For Ezra, Meshullam; for Amariah, Jehohanan.

verses.latin: Milicho, Jonathan: Sebaniae, Joseph:
verses.english: For Malluch, Jonathan; for Shebaniah, Joseph.

verses.latin: Harim, Ednai: Maraioth, Helci:
verses.english: For Harim, Adna; for Meremoth, Helkai.

verses.latin: Addo, Zacharia: Genthon, Mosollam:
verses.english: For Iddo, Zechariah; for Ginnethon, Meshullam.

verses.latin: Abiae, Zechri: Miamin et Moedia, Phelti:
verses.english: For Abijah, Zichri; for Miniamin, for Moadiah, Piltai.

verses.latin: Belgae, Sammua: Semaiae, Jonathan:
verses.english: For Bilgah, Shammua; for Shemaiah, Jehonathan.

verses.latin: Joiarib, Mathanai: Jedaiae, Azzi:
verses.english: For Joiarib, Mattaniah; for Jedaiah, Uzzi.

verses.latin: Sallai, Cellai: Amoc, Heber:
verses.english: For Sallai, Kallai; for Amok, Eber.

verses.latin: Helciae, Hasabia: Jedaiae, Nathanael.
verses.english: For Hilkiah, Hashabiah; for Jedaiah, Nethanel.

verses.latin: Levitae in diebus Eliasib, et Jojada, et Johanan, et Jeddoa, scripti sunt principes familiarum, et sacerdotes, in regno Darii Persae.
verses.english: The Levites, during the days of Eliashib, Joiada, Johanan, and Jaddua, were recorded as heads of families. The priests were also recorded during the reign of Darius the Persian.

verses.latin: Filii Levi, principes familiarum scripti sunt in libro verborum dierum, usque ad dies Jonathan filii Eliasib.
verses.english: The sons of Levi, the heads of families, were recorded in the book of the chronicles up to the time of Jonathan, the son of Eliashib.

verses.latin: Et principes Levitarum: Hasabia, Serebia, et Josue filius Cedmihel, et fratres eorum per vices suas, ut laudarent, et confiterentur juxta praeceptum David viri Dei, et custodia contra custodiam.
verses.english: The leading Levites were Hashabiah, Sherebiah, and Jeshua, the son of Kadmiel, with their brothers, who stood opposite them in their assigned sections to offer praise and thanksgiving, according to the command of David, the man of God, keeping watch in opposing shifts.

verses.latin: Mathania, et Bacbucia, Obadia, Mosollam, Telmon, Accub, custodes portarum et vestibulorum ante portas.
verses.english: Mattaniah, Bakbukiah, Obadiah, Meshullam, Talmon, and Akkub were gatekeepers, guarding the storerooms at the gates.

verses.latin: Hi in diebus Joacim filii Josue filii Josedec, et in diebus Nehemiae ducis, et Esdrae sacerdotis scribae.
verses.english: These served in the days of Joiakim, the son of Jeshua, the son of Jozadak, and in the days of Nehemiah the governor, and of Ezra the priest, the scribe.

verses.latin: In dedicatione autem muri Jerusalem, requisierunt Levitas de omnibus locis suis, ut adducerent eos in Jerusalem, et facerent dedicationem in laetitia, in gratiarum actione, et cantico, et cymbalis, et psalteriis, et citharis.
verses.english: At the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, they diligently sought out the Levites from all their places to bring them to Jerusalem so that they might celebrate the dedication with joy and thanksgiving, with songs accompanied by cymbals, harps, and lyres.

verses.latin: Congregati sunt ergo filii cantorum de campestribus circuitus Jerusalem, et de villis Netophati,
verses.english: So the descendants of the singers gathered themselves from the countryside around Jerusalem, and from the villages of the Netophathites.

verses.latin: et de domo Galgal, et de regionibus Geba et Azmaveth: quoniam villas aedificaverant sibi cantores in circuitu Jerusalem.
verses.english: They came from Beth Gilgal and from the regions of Geba and Azmaveth, for the singers had built villages for themselves all around Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et purificati sunt sacerdotes et Levitae: et purificaverunt populum, et portas, et murum.
verses.english: The priests and Levites first purified themselves; then they purified the people, the gates, and the wall.

verses.latin: Et ascendere feci principes Judae super murum, et statui duas magnas choros laudantium. Et dexter chorus ibat super murum ad portam sterquilinii.
verses.english: Then I made the leaders of Judah go up on the wall, and I appointed two great choirs to give thanks. One procession went to the right, along the wall, toward the Dung Gate.

verses.latin: Et post eos ibat Osaias, et media pars principum Judae,
verses.english: And behind them went Hoshaiah and half of the leaders of Judah.

verses.latin: et Azarias, Esdras, et Mosollam, Juda, et Benjamin, et Semeia, et Jeremias.
verses.english: Also Azariah, Ezra, Meshullam, Judah, Benjamin, Shemaiah, and Jeremiah.

verses.latin: Et quidam de filiis sacerdotum cum tubis, Zacharias filius Jonathan, filii Semeiae, filii Mathaniae, filii Michaiae, filii Zaccur, filii Asaph,
verses.english: And some of the sons of the priests with trumpets, including Zechariah, the son of Jonathan, the son of Shemaiah, the son of Mattaniah, the son of Micaiah, the son of Zaccur, the son of Asaph.

verses.latin: et fratres ejus Semeia, et Azareel, Malalai, Galalai, Maai, Nathanael, et Judas, et Hanani, in organis cantici David viri Dei, et Esdras scriba ante eos.
verses.english: And his brothers: Shemaiah, Azarel, Milalai, Gilalai, Maai, Nethanel, Judah, and Hanani, with the musical instruments of David, the man of God. Ezra the scribe walked before them.

verses.latin: Et ad portam fontis, et contra eos, ascenderunt in gradibus civitatis David in ascensu muri super domum David, et usque ad portam aquarum orientem.
verses.english: At the Fountain Gate, they continued directly forward, ascending the steps of the City of David, up the ascent of the wall above the house of David, and as far as the Water Gate on the east.

verses.latin: Et chorus secundus gratiarum actionis ibat ex adverso, et ego post eum, et media pars populi super murum, et super turrim furnorum, et usque ad murum latum,
verses.english: The second choir of thanksgiving went in the opposite direction, and I followed it with half of the people, along the wall, past the Tower of the Ovens, and as far as the Broad Wall.

verses.latin: et super portam Ephraim, et super portam veterem, et super portam piscium, et turrim Hananeel, et turrim Meah, et usque ad portam Gregis: et steterunt in porta custodiae.
verses.english: They continued above the Gate of Ephraim, and above the Old Gate, and above the Fish Gate, and the Tower of Hananel, and the Tower of the Hundred, as far as the Sheep Gate; and they halted at the Guard Gate.

verses.latin: Steteruntque sacerdotes, et Levitae, et cantores, et janitores, et Nathinaei, in omnibus civitatibus Judae, et in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Then the priests, the Levites, the singers, the gatekeepers, and the Nethinim took their positions in all the cities of Judah and in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: Et laetati sunt sacerdotes, et Levitae in die illa, et cantaverunt canticum magna, et chorus eorum in omnibus civitatibus Judae, et in Jerusalem.
verses.english: And the priests and Levites rejoiced on that day, and they sang a great song, with their choir performing in all the cities of Judah and in Jerusalem.

verses.latin: In diebus illis, legitur in libro Moysi in audientia populi, et inventum est scriptum in eo, quod non introirent Amorrhæi et Moabithæ in ecclesiam Dei usque in æternum:
verses.english: In those days, a passage was read aloud from the book of Moses for all the people to hear. It was discovered to be written in it that the Ammonites and Moabites were not permitted to enter the assembly of God, and were to be excluded forever.

verses.latin: eo quod non occurrerint filiis Israël cum pane et aqua, et conduxerint contra eum Balaam ad maledicendum ei: et avertit Deus noster maledictionem in benedictionem.
verses.english: The reason for this prohibition was that these nations did not meet the children of Israel with bread and water when Israel was journeying through their lands. Moreover, they hired Balaam to curse Israel, but our God turned that curse into a blessing.

verses.latin: Et factum est, cum audissent legem, separaverunt omnem alienigenam ex Israël.
verses.english: So it came to pass that when they heard this law, they immediately separated all foreigners from among Israel.

verses.latin: Ante hoc autem, Eliasib sacerdos, qui præerat in gazophylacio domus Dei nostri, et proximus erat Tobia,
verses.english: Now, before these events, Eliasib the priest, who was in charge of the storerooms of the house of our God, had become allied with Tobia.

verses.latin: fecerat ei gazophylacium grande: et illuc reposuerant ante hæc thesauros, et thura, et vasa, et decimam frumenti, vini, et olei, partes Levitarum, et cantorum, et janitorum, et primitias sacerdotales.
verses.english: This Eliasib had prepared a large storeroom for Tobia, a place where they had previously kept the treasures, incense, vessels, the tithe of grain, wine, and oil (which were the portions for the Levites, singers, and gatekeepers), and also the priestly first-fruits.

verses.latin: In omnibus autem his non eram in Jerusalem, quia anno trigesimo secundo Artaxerxis regis Babylonis, veni ad regem, et in fine dierum rogavi regem,
verses.english: During all these events, I was not in Jerusalem, because in the thirty-second year of Artaxerxes, the king of Babylon, I had gone to the king. After some time, I requested leave from the king to return.

verses.latin: et veni in Jerusalem: et intellexi malum quod fecerat Eliasib Tobia, ut faceret ei gazophylacium in vestibulo domus Domini.
verses.english: So I came to Jerusalem. When I arrived, I understood the great evil that Eliasib had done for Tobia, by allowing him to have a storeroom prepared in the outer court of the house of the Lord.

verses.latin: Et malum mihi visum est valde: et projeci omnia vasa domus Tobia foras de gazophylacio.
verses.english: This action seemed extremely wicked to me. So I immediately threw all of Tobia's household goods out of that storeroom.

verses.latin: Præcepique, et mundaverunt gazophylacia: et reportavi ibi vasa domus Dei, cum thure et cum oleo.
verses.english: I then gave orders, and they purified the storerooms. After this, I brought back there the vessels of the house of God, along with the incense and the oil for sacred use.

verses.latin: Et cognovi quod partes Levitarum non fuissent datæ, et fugisset unusquisque de Levitis et de cantoribus et de janitoribus, ad regionem suam:
verses.english: I also learned that the portions due to the Levites had not been given to them. Because of this, every one of the Levites, singers, and gatekeepers had fled back to his own land, unable to perform their duties.

verses.latin: et litigavi adversum magistratus, et dixi: Quare dereliquimus domum Dei? Et congregavi illos, et constitui in stationibus suis.
verses.english: So I confronted the magistrates and rebuked them, saying, "Why have we abandoned the house of God and neglected its servants?" Then I gathered the Levites and their fellow workers and restored them to their proper stations and responsibilities.

verses.latin: Et omnis Juda attulit decimam frumenti, et vini, et olei, in horrea.
verses.english: After this, all of Judah brought the tithe of grain, wine, and oil into the storerooms of the temple.

verses.latin: Et constituimus super horrea, thesaurarios Sellemian sacerdotem, et Sadoc scribam, et Phadaiam de Levitis: et juxta hos Hanan filium Zaccur filii Mathania: quoniam fideles comprobati sunt, et ipsis credita sunt distribuere partes fratribus suis.
verses.english: We then appointed treasurers over these storerooms: Sellemian the priest, Sadoc the scribe, and Phadaia from the Levites. Alongside these, we appointed Hanan, the son of Zaccur, the son of Mathania. These men were chosen because they had proven themselves faithful, and to them was entrusted the responsibility of distributing the portions to their brothers.

verses.latin: Memento mei, Deus meus, pro hoc, et ne deleas miserationes meas, quas feci in domo Dei mei, et in cæremoniis ejus.
verses.english: My God, remember me for these actions. Do not erase the merciful deeds I have performed for the house of my God and for its sacred services.

verses.latin: In diebus illis vidi in Juda calcantes torcularia sabbatis, onerantes acervos, et inferentes sabata, et vinum, et uvas, et ficus, et omne onus: et portant in die sabbati in Jerusalem. Et comminatus sum, quando venderent cibaria.
verses.english: In those days, I saw people in Judah pressing wine in the winepresses on the Sabbath day. Others were bringing in sheaves of grain, wine, grapes, figs, and all kinds of burdens, and they were bringing them into Jerusalem on the Sabbath day. So I sternly warned them against selling food and other goods on that holy day.

verses.latin: Et Tyrii habitaverunt in ea, inferentes pisces, et universa venalia: et vendebant in sabbatis filiis Juda, et in Jerusalem.
verses.english: Even the Tyrians who lived in Jerusalem were bringing in fish and all sorts of merchandise. They were selling these goods to the children of Judah and within Jerusalem on the Sabbath day.

verses.latin: Et objurgavi optimates Judæ, et dixi eis: Quæ est hæc res mala quam vos facitis, et profanatis diem sabbati?
verses.english: I therefore rebuked the nobles of Judah and said to them, "What is this evil thing that you are doing, by profaning the Sabbath day in such a way?"

verses.latin: Numquid non patres nostri sic fecerunt, et adduxit Deus noster super nos omne malum hoc, et super civitatem hanc? Et vos additis iracundiam super Israël, violando sabbatum.
verses.english: "Did not your fathers do the very same things? And because of that, our God brought all this terrible evil upon us and upon this city. Now you are adding to God's wrath against Israel by violating the Sabbath."

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum siluissent portæ Jerusalem in die sabbati, et clausissem januas, et præcepissem, ne aperirentur usque post sabbatum: et de pueris meis posui super portas, ut nullum onus inferretur in die sabbati.
verses.english: So it came to pass that when the gates of Jerusalem began to grow dark before the Sabbath, I ordered them to be shut. I commanded that they should not be opened until after the Sabbath had passed. I also stationed some of my own servants at the gates, so that no burden could be brought in on the Sabbath day.

verses.latin: Et manserunt mercatores, et vendentes universa venalia, foris Jerusalem semel et bis.
verses.english: Once or twice, the merchants and those who sold all sorts of wares camped outside Jerusalem, waiting for the Sabbath to end.

verses.latin: Et contestatus sum eos, et dixi eis: Quare manetis ex adverso muri? Si secundo hoc feceritis, manum mittam in vos. Et ex tempore non venerunt in sabbato.
verses.english: But I warned them strongly, saying, "Why do you remain camping opposite the wall? If you do this a second time, I will lay hands on you with force." From that time onward, they stopped coming to Jerusalem on the Sabbath.

verses.latin: Præcepi quoque Levitis ut mundarentur, et venirent ad custodiendas portas, et sanctificarent diem sabbati: et pro hoc quoque memento mei, Deus meus, et parce mihi secundum multitudinem miserationum tuarum.
verses.english: I also commanded the Levites to purify themselves and to come and guard the gates, so that they might keep the Sabbath day holy. For this action too, remember me, my God, and spare me according to the abundance of your mercies.

verses.latin: In diebus illis vidi et Judæos ducentes uxores Azotidas, et Ammonitidas, et Moabitas.
verses.english: In those days, I also saw Jews who had married wives from Ashdod, Ammon, and Moab.

verses.latin: Et filii eorum ex media parte loquebantur Azotice, et non poterant loqui Judaice: et juxta linguam populi et populi.
verses.english: Half of their children spoke the language of Ashdod, and could not speak the language of Judah, but spoke according to the language of each people they were mixed with.

verses.latin: Et litigavi cum eis, et maledixi eis, et cecidi ex eis viros, et decalvavi eos, et juramentum exegi ab eis per Deum, quod non darent filias suas filiis eorum, et non acciperent de filiabus eorum filiis suis, et sibi, dicens:
verses.english: So I confronted them, and I cursed them. I struck some of the men and pulled out their hair. I then made them swear an oath by God, promising that they would not give their daughters to the sons of these foreign women, nor take their daughters for their sons, nor for themselves, saying:

verses.latin: Numquid non in his peccavit Salomon rex Israël? Et in gentibus multis non erat rex similis ei, et dilectus Deo suo erat, et posuit eum Deus noster regem super omnem Israël: et ipsum transgressum fecerunt mulieres alienigenæ.
verses.english: "Was it not because of such practices that Solomon, the king of Israel, sinned? Among many nations, there was no king like him; he was beloved by his God, and our God made him king over all Israel. Yet even he was led into transgression by foreign women."

verses.latin: Et vos ergo audiremus facientes omne malum grande hoc, ut prævaricemini in Deum nostrum, ducentes uxores alienigenas?
verses.english: "Are we then to hear about you doing all this great evil, committing a transgression against our God by marrying foreign women?"

verses.latin: Et de filiis Jojadæ filii Eliasib sacerdotis magni, gener erat Sanaballat Horonitis, quem fugavi a me.
verses.english: One of the sons of Jojada, the son of Eliasib the high priest, was a son-in-law of Sanaballat the Horonite. I chased this man away from me, expelling him from the community.

verses.latin: Memento, Deus meus, eis qui polluunt sacerdotium, et pactum sacerdotale, et Leviticum.
verses.english: My God, remember those who defile the priesthood and the covenant of the priests and the Levites.

verses.latin: Itaque mundavi eos ab omni alieno, et constitui ordines sacerdotum et Levitarum, unumquemque in ministerio suo:
verses.english: So I cleansed them from all foreign influence and practices. I then established the proper divisions for the priests and the Levites, appointing each one to his own ministry and duties.

verses.latin: et in oblatione lignorum, et primitiarum in temporibus suis: memento mei, Deus meus, in bonum.
verses.english: I also made sure that provisions were made for the offering of wood and the first-fruits, each at their appointed times. My God, remember me for good in all these things.
